talent.tests: Cool to oppose Riverwarden's Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

talent.description: You can read and write (if appropriate) all of the Languages you can speak.
talent.name: Read/Write

talent.description: Permanent +5 bonus to Fellowship Characteristic (Fel) that does not count towards Advances.
talent.name: Suave

talent.description: If you win an Opposed Melee Test, instead of gaining +1 Advantage, you may chose to remove 1 Advantage from the opposing Advantage Pool and add it to your own. In that case, you do not cause any Damage, even if it is your Turn.
talent.name: Reversal

talent.description: Permanently add your Toughness Bonus (TB) to your Wounds. The extra Wounds increase if  your TB increases.
talent.name: Hardy

talent.name: Sharpshooter

talent.description: When Charging, add level of Resolute to your Strength Bonus.
talent.name: Resolute

talent.description:
When exposed to a new Language for at least a month, you may take an Intelligence Test. If successful, you can use this Language as a Basic Skill. This Test can be attempted once a month. 
Linguistics applies only to regular Languages, not to professional ones (such as Battle or Magick).
talent.name: Linguistics

talent.description: You have a gift for mathematics. That include solving complex problems and doing exceptional in-memory calculations.
talent.name: Super Numerate

talent.description: Add level of this Talent to SL of any Reload Tests of a ranged weapon. Reloading a ranged weapon in combat now counts as Assess action. Gain +1 Advantage when making Assess Test to Reload.
talent.name: Rapid Reload

talent.description: Once per Round, if you successfully hit your opponent in close combat, you can spend Advantage or Move to make an extra attack.
talent.name: Furious Assault

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Criminals.
talent.name: Etiquette - Criminal

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Boatbuilder Guilders.
talent.name: Etiquette - Guilder - Boatmen

talent.description: Anytime you gain a Prone Condition, you may take a Challenging (+0) Athletics Test to imminently stand back up. This Test is modified by +/- 10 for every 10 points of Strength the blow has over/under your Toughness.
talent.name: Jump Up

talent.description: In addition to usual rules, You can take an extra Cool Test to remove Broken Condition at the end of each Round.
talent.name: Stout-hearted
talent.tests: Cool Tests to remove Broken Conditions

talent.description: You may ignore all penalties to Melee Tests due to fighting is tight spaces. You can use your Dodge Skill in enclosed small spaces where you normally wouldn't be allowed to sue it.
talent.name: Enclosed Fighter

talent.description: You may now memorise spells from The Lore of Demonology.
talent.name: Arcane Magic - Daemonology

talent.description: You know a number of pieces of information equal to the level of this Talent about the Medicine without taking the Lore - Medicine Skill Test.
talent.name: Savant - Medicine

talent.description:
After a successful Willpower Test, you can go Frenzy.
You become immune to all psychology and cannot flee or retreat. Each round you must either attack or move at full speed towards a target. You can only take Weapon Skill or Athletics (to reach the opponent) Tests. Each round you have an extra Free Action Melee Test and +1 Strength Bonus. You remain in the state of Frenzy until all opponents are dead (or appear dead) or you get Stunned or Unconscious Conditions. After Frenzy is over, you get Fatigued Condition.
talent.name: Frenzy

talent.description: Your size is Small instead of Average.
talent.name: Small

talent.description:
You can follow someone secretly (Shadowing) without taking a combined Combined Perception and Stealth Test (Opposed with target's Stealth Skill if the target is trying to lose the tail).
Instead, you may take a Perception or Stealth Skill Test (whichever is higher). This Test is also Opposed with target's Stealth Skill if the target is trying to lose the tail
talent.name: Shadow

talent.description: If you fail a Gossip Test, you may reverse the die roll if that gives you Success.
talent.name: Gregarious

talent.description: When shoot at with a Blackpowder weapon, you have to take a Cool Test to avoid Broken Condition only if you are wounded.
talent.name: Unshakeable
talent.tests: Cool Tests to resist Blackpowder panic

talent.description:
You can chose to fight dirty in a fist fight: add +1 Damage for each level of Dirty Fighting to any successful Melee - Brawling hit.
Use of this Talent in any formal fight will be considered cheating.
talent.name: Dirty Fighting

talent.description: You ignore Wounds from Bleeding Condition. Each level of Implacable lets you ignore Wounds from an extra Bleeding Condition.
talent.name: Implacable

talent.description: When using Stealth - Underground, others do not get a Perception Test to detect you, unless they are specifically looking for you.
talent.name: Tunnel Rat

talent.description: Pass automatically the first test against disease. The SL of such test is your TB.
talent.name: Resistance - Disease

talent.description: You may now memorise spells from The Lore of Light.
talent.name: Arcane Magic - Light

talent.description: You can cast Blessings of one of the Divine Lores. Normally, you can know only one Divine Lore.
talent.name: Bless

talent.description: You can deploy Blessings of Ranald - God of Trickery.
talent.name: Bless - Ranald

talent.description: You can deploy Blessings of Verena - Goddess of Wisdom.
talent.name: Bless - Verena

talent.description: You may now empower miracles of Sigmar - God of The Empire.
talent.name: Invoke - Sigmar

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Physician Guilders.
talent.name: Etiquette - Guilder - Physician

talent.description: You know a number of pieces of information equal to the level of this Talent about the Riverways without taking the Lore - Riverways Skill Test.
talent.name: Savant - Riverways

talent.description: Permanent +5 bonus to Intelligence Characteristic (Int) that does not count towards Advances.
talent.name: Savvy

talent.description: You can you your Move to perform Distraction on your opponent  by Testing Opposed Athletics/Cool.  If you win, your opponent can generate no Advantage for their Pool until the end of the next Round.
talent.name: Distract

talent.description: When using Dodge, if you win the Opposed Test, you can move up to 2 yards and no longer count as Engaged. Opponent do not get a Free Attack.
talent.name: Step Aside
talent.tests: Dodge Tests to activate this Talent

talent.description: You take Perception Tests to spot traps automatically without having to tell the GM of your intention. The GM may take these tests for you.
talent.name: Trapper
talent.tests: Perception Tests to spot traps, Set Trap

talent.description: When determining how long can you hold your breath underwater, add the level of this Talent to you Toughness Bonus.
talent.name: Strong Swimmer

talent.description: If you fail a Stealth - Urban Test, you may reverse the die roll if that lets you succeed.
talent.name: Alley Cat

talent.description: In combat  situations when you would be affected by Surprise, you may take a Challenging (+0) Perception Test to ignore it. This Test is modified by circumstances.
talent.name: Combat Aware

talent.description:
You can recall long sequences of items. Every new sequence you learn replaces a previous one. Each level of Tower of Memories allows you to store an additional sequence.
You can remember a sequence as log as your Intelligence Characteristic without any Test.
Above that, for each additional 10 items, you have to attempt increasingly difficult Intelligence Test, starting from Very Easy (+60), then Easy (+40), Average (+20), and so on.
This Talent adds a bonus between +20 and +60 to Gamble Tests (depends on the game).
talent.name: Tower of Memories

talent.description:
Beneath Notice lets you avoid being noticed by those with higher Status. As long as you don't make anything out of ordinary, you can stay around and listen to conversations without raising suspicions.
In combat, those with higher Status do not get Advantage for striking or wounding you.
talent.name: Beneath Notice

talent.description: Allows to blend in with the associated social group.
talent.name: Etiquette

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from Monsters.
talent.name: Fearless - Monsters
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Monster's Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Merchant Guilders.
talent.name: Etiquette - Guilder - Merchant

talent.description: Allows to take Perception Test to detect barely detectable visual details, for example things that are far away, very small, or do not stand out from the background.
talent.name: Acute Sense - Sight

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from Rats.
talent.name: Fearless - Rats
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Rat's Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

talent.description:
You may memorize Petty Magic spells. When you take this Talent, you memorize a number of spells equal to your Willpower Bonus.
The XP cost of memorizing a new spell depends on the number of spell already known: new spell cost = round down("number of spells known" / "WP Bonus" + 1) * 50 XP.
talent.name: Petty Magic

talent.description: You may now empower miracles of Morr - God of Death.
talent.name: Invoke - Morr

talent.description: Allows to take Perception Test to detect barely detectable tactile details and features.
talent.name: Acute Sense - Touch

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from Skaven.
talent.name: Fearless - Skaven
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Skaven's Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

talent.description: Allows to take one free Crafting Endeavour or Brew Potion to use Trade - Apothecary or Trade - Alchemy without need of a Workshop. Other Crafting Endeavours use the normal rules.
talent.name: Concoct

talent.description: When performing Tests with you secondary hand, you suffer -10 penalty (instead of -20). If you take Ambidextrous twice, you don't suffer any penalty.
talent.name: Ambidextrous

talent.description: You can reverse any failed Trade (Apothecary) test if this allows the Test to succeed.
talent.name: Pharmacist

talent.description: Permanent +5 bonus to Dexterity Characteristic (Dex) that does not count towards Advances.
talent.name: Nimble Fingered

talent.description: Once per Round, all subordinates able to see you, can add the level of this Talent to the SL of their Willpower Test. If multiple War Leaders are present, the bonus does not stack.
talent.name: War Leader

talent.description: Permanent +5 bonus to Toughness Characteristic (T) that does not count towards Advances.
talent.name: Very Resilient

talent.description:
You have a great talent for sketching and painting. 
Add the Trade - Artist to any Career you enter. If the Career already has that Trade Skill, you can obtain the Skill for 5 XP fewer per Advance.
talent.name: Artistic

talent.description: When comparing your Status to others, assuming you have appropriate cloths, you are always assumed to have higher Status. The only exception from this rule is when others also have this Talent, in which case the Status is compared as normal.
talent.name: Noble Blood
talent.tests: Any Test influenced by your Status

talent.description: For the purpose of repairing a broken item, you can can assume you have a relevant non-magical Trade as a Basic Skill.
talent.name: Tinker
talent.tests: Trade Tests to repair broken items

talent.description: Add the associated Trade Skill to any Career you enter. If the Career already has that Trade Skill, you can obtain the Skill for 5 XP fewer per Advance.
talent.name: Craftsman

talent.description: Lets you reduce required SL of any Extended Test using your Trade - Engineer Skill by the level of your Master Tradesman  - Engineer Talent.
talent.name: Master Tradesman - Engineer

talent.description: Ignore all movement penalties when moving through Coasts.
talent.name: Strider - Coastal

talent.description: You may now memorise spells from The Lore of Fire.
talent.name: Arcane Magic - Fire

talent.description: You can empower miracles from your chosen Divine Lore. The XP cost of learning a new miracle depends on the number of miracles already known: new miracle cost = "number of miracles known" * 100 XP. Normally you cannot learn to Invoke more than one Divine Lore.  Having this Talent also prevents you from having Arcane Magic and Petty Magic Talents. You can unlearn it for 100 XP but you will lose all miracles and anger the Divine Lore's deity.
talent.name: Invoke

talent.description: When you touch an item, you may take Intuition Test to sense if it is magical. Each SL provides extra information about special rules that apply to the item. You may attempt this Test only once per artefact you touch.
talent.name: Detect Artefact
talent.tests: Intuition tests to detect magical artefacts

talent.description: Those with Second Sight see grey wind around you. You can use Channelling - Ulgu skill in place of Stealth skill for any Test. All successful spell casts (within 8 yards) from the Lore of Shadow receive +1 SL. This bonus applies only once, even if there are multiple people with Suffused with Ulgu within 8 yards.
talent.name: Suffused With Ulgu

talent.description: Permanent +5 bonus to Ballistic Skill Characteristic (BS) that does not count towards Advances.
talent.name: Marksman

talent.description: If you fail a Test to navigate dangerous waters, you can reverse the roll. If you do that, your SL is capped at +1.
talent.name: Pilot
talent.tests: Row or Sail Tests while navigating unsure waters

talent.description: Increase your Movement by +1 when Fleeing or when you are the Quarry in a pursuit.
talent.name: Flee!
talent.tests: Athletics when Fleeing or when the Quarry in a pursuit

talent.description: Allows use of the senses to take a Perception Test to detect otherwise undetectable details.
talent.name: Acute Sense

talent.description: Allows to take Perception Test to detect barely detectable smells.
talent.name: Acute Sense - Smell

talent.description: You know a number of pieces of information equal to the level of this Talent about Altdorf without taking the Lore - Local - Altdorf Test.
talent.name: Savant - Local -  Altdorf

talent.description: You know a number of pieces of information equal to the level of this Talent about the Law without taking the Lore - Law Skill Test.
talent.name: Savant - Law

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from Intruders.
talent.name: Fearless - Intruders
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Intruder's Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

talent.description: You may now memorise spells from The Lore of Death.
talent.name: Arcane Magic - Death

talent.description: Add Language - Magick Skill to any Career you enter. If the Career already has that Trade (Apothecary), you can obtain it for 5 XP fewer per Advance. For a the cost of 1 Resilience point, you can immediately cast any spell and memorize it as if it was one of your Arcane Lore spells (for 0 XP). You can do this for each level of Witch!
talent.name: Witch!

talent.description: You can deploy Blessings of Manann - God of The Sea.
talent.name: Bless - Manann

talent.description: You can deploy Blessings of Ulric - God of War.
talent.name: Bless - Ulric

talent.description: You may now empower miracles of Myrmidia - Goddess of Strategy.
talent.name: Invoke - Myrmidia

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from Beastmen.
talent.name: Fearless - Beastmen
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Beastmen's Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

talent.description: When passing through dangerous riverways, we do not need to take Test until the Difficulty is -10 or lower (you pass automatically). If you posses appropriate Lore - Local,  you do not need to Test for navigating waters even if Difficulty is -10 or lower.
talent.name: River Guide
talent.tests: Any Lore Test concerning river matters

talent.description: Lets you reduce required SL of any Extended Test using your Trade - Boatbuilder Skill by the level of your Master Tradesman - Boatbuilder Talent.
talent.name: Master Tradesman - Boatbuilder

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Rat Catcher Guilders.
talent.name: Etiquette - Guilder - Rat Catcher

talent.description:
Each day, you must pray at  least half an hour to your God and maintain number of Wounds equal to the level of Flagellant. If you fail to pray or maintain Wounds you cannot spend any Resilience or Resolve until you resume prayers and/or Wounds.
If you have Frenzy Talent, you can go into state of Frenzy without testing Willpower. The Frenzy Talent is added to the Talent list of any Career you are in.
talent.name: Flagellant
talent.tests: Any for resisting the Ruinous Powers

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from any enemy.
talent.name: Fearless - Everything
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Fear, and Terror

talent.description: When determining Damage, you may use your opponents Toughness Bonus instead of your Strengths Bonus if it is larger. This is done before other Strengths modifiers are applied. If you score a Critical on an larger opponent, multiply all melee Damage times the number of levels you opponent is larger than you. Multiplication is done after all other modifiers are applied.
talent.name: Slayer

talent.description: On hit with a ranged weapon, instead of using standard rules, you may pick the Hit Location.
talent.name: Deadeye Shot

talent.description: When using ranged weapon, you suffer no penalties at Long range, and half of regular penalties at Extreme range.
talent.name: Sniper

talent.description: Permanent +5 bonus to Strength Characteristic (S) that does not count towards Advances.
talent.name: Very Strong

talent.description: Ignore all penalties when Testing Sail using river vessels.  You count as two, towards the minimum required number of crew members to operate a river ship.
talent.name: Waterman

talent.description:
When learning this Talent, chose a way it was foretold how you die.
If you die in a way it was prophesied, your new character gains a half the total of your dead character's XP points.
talent.name: Doomed

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Soldiers.
talent.name: Etiquette - Solider

talent.description: You know a number of pieces of information equal to the level of this Talent about the Engineering without taking the Lore - Engineer Skill Test.
talent.name: Savant - Engineer

talent.description: Double rolls on successful Channel Test do not cause Miscast anymore.
talent.name: Aethyric Attunement

talent.description: You may now empower miracles of of Ranald - God of Trickery.
talent.name: Invoke - Ranald

talent.description: You can fit through narrowings and gaps you normally would not be be able to.
talent.name: Contortionist
talent.tests: Perform and Agility Tests when contorting helps

talent.description:
On encountering a member of Heretics, you must attempt a Psychology Test. If failed you are subject to Hatred. You can attempt Psychology Test at the end of every subsequent Round to stop the Hatred.
While subject to Hatred, you must attack the Heretics. You gain +1 SL to all combat Tests versus them and you are immune to Fear and Intimidate (but not Terror) caused by the Heretics.
talent.name: Hatred - Heretics

talent.description: With this Talent, the cost of bribery is reduced by 10% per Talent level, up to a minimum of 10% of the original cost.
talent.name: Briber

talent.description:
You can shot from a ranged weapon before anyone can react that Turn (outside of your Initiative Order). If you do, you lose both your Action and Move for the following Round. 
If multiple characters are using Fast Shot, the order is determined by the level of this Talent. In case of identical levels, both shots occur simultaneously.
talent.name: Fast Shot
talent.tests: Ranged when making a Fast Shot

talent.description: If you are out-numbered, for each level of this Talent, you count as one more person for the purposes of determining if one side out-numbers the other.
talent.name: Combat Master

talent.description: Add Lore (Local) to any Career you Enter. If that Career already has a Lore (Local) Skill, you can take and additional (Local) specialization for 5XP fewer per Advance.
talent.name: Seasoned Traveller
talent.tests: Any Lore Test concerning local detail

talent.description: All animals with the Bestial Trait will be calm in your presence. The exceptions from this rue is when thew animal is either trained to be aggressive or has a good reason for it (being hurt, defending offspring, etc.).
talent.name: Animal Affinity

talent.description:
You can reverse die roll on any failed Research Test if that will score a success.
In combat, a successful Language Test allows you to read SL + Speed reader level number of pages per Round. Even if you fail the Test, you can still read 1 page in during the Round.
talent.name: Speedreader
talent.tests: Research and Language Tests where speed of reading is important

talent.description: Lets you reduce required SL of any Extended Test using your Trade Skill by the level of your Master Tradesman Talent.
talent.name: Master Tradesman

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from Animals.
talent.name: Fearless - Animals
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Animalâ€™s Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

talent.description: Pass automatically the first test against Chaos. The SL of such test is your TB.
talent.name: Resistance - Chaos
talent.tests: All those to resist Chaos influences

talent.description: Double rolls on successful Language - Magick Test do not cause Miscast anymore.
talent.name: Instinctive Diction

talent.description: You can treat Critical Wounds marked as needing Surgery. You can perform surgery: Extended Challenging (+0) Heal Test with target SL determined by your GM (usually 5-10). The Test causes 1d10 Wounds and 1 Bleeding Condition per Test. After successful surgery, the patient has to take Average (+20) Endurance Test to avoid Minor Infection.
talent.name: Surgery
talent.tests: Heal Tests outside combat rounds; i.e. when you have time to do it â€˜properlyâ€™

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from Watchmen.
talent.name: Fearless - Watchmen
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Watchman's Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

talent.description: When you need a particular item (you do not currently have), Well-prepared lets you have it as if you had it all along. The item has to have Encumbrance 0 and had been available for you to purchase recently. You need to deduct its cost from your purse. You can use this Talent number of times equal to its level per session.
talent.name: Well-prepared

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Stevedore Guilders.
talent.name: Etiquette - Guilder - Stevedore

talent.description:
You can Attack with your both hands for you Action. You perform main hand attack as normal. If the main hand attack hits, you may attack with second hand any available target. 

If the main hand roll was NOT A CRITICAL, for secondary hand attack hit roll use the first one but reversed (for example, from 34 to 43). 
If the main hand attack WAS A CRITICAL, for your second attack use your Critical Table roll.

Damage of the second attack is calculated as normal. Secondary hand attack Test also suffers -20 penalty unless you have Ambidextrous Talent.

When you attack with both weapons, all your defensive rolls take -10 penalty until you next Turn. Unless both attacks hit, you do not gain an Advantage.
talent.name: Dual Wielder
talent.tests: Melee or Ranged when attacking with two weapons

talent.description:
When being charged, you may take a Challenging (+0) Initiative Test to gain an immediate Free Attack on the charging opponent. This attack is performed with the weapon in your main hand.
Each round, you may use this Talent the number of times equal to its level (but only once per charging enemy).
talent.name: Reaction Strike

talent.description: While outside, you always can tell where the north is.
talent.name: Orientation

talent.description:
You can see clearly in the low light conditions (there has to be some faint source of light) for 20 yards per level of Night Vision. 
Night Vision extends the effectiveness of any light sources by 20 yards per level.
talent.name: Night Vision

talent.description: On a successful Endurance Test, you can endure the situation twice as long as you would normally.
talent.name: Tenacious

talent.description:
You ignore all weapon reach penalties when fighting opponent with longer reach weapon.
While in-fighting, you get +10 to hit.
talent.name: In-fighter
talent.tests: Melee when in-fighting, or to enter in-fighting

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Lawyer Guilders.
talent.name: Etiquette - Guilder - Lawyer

talent.description: When Begging, you may take Charm Test every half hour instead of every hour.
talent.name: Panhandle

talent.description: When determining Hit Location, you can modify your roll by +/- 10 for each level of Careful Strike.
talent.name: Careful Strike

talent.description: After a successful social Skill test to influence a superior, you may use unit die roll as SL.
talent.name: Supportive
talent.tests: Social Tests to influence a superior

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Cultists.
talent.name: Etiquette - Cultists

talent.description: Allows use of the senses to take a Perception Test to detect otherwise undetectable details.
talent.name: Acute Sense - Taste or Touch

talent.description: Your family is considered new to Laurelorn. You are always considered lower Status by other Eonir unless they also have this talent.
talent.name: Youngblood
talent.tests: Any Social Tests with other Eonir

talent.description: You know a number of pieces of information equal to the level of this Talent about Mootland terrain without taking the Lore - Moot terrain Test.
talent.name: Savant - Moot terrain

talent.description: You know a number of pieces of information equal to the level of this Talent about Mootland without taking the Lore - Local - Mootland Test.
talent.name: Savant - Local - Moot

talent.name: Savant - Dwarf Holds and Routes
talent.tests: Lore - Herbs - Dwarf Holds and Routes

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from Undead.
talent.name: Fearless - Undead
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Undeadâ€™s Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

On encountering a member of Undead, you must attempt a Psychology Test. If failed you are subject to Hatred. You can attempt Psychology Test at the end of every subsequent Round to stop the Hatred.
While subject to Hatred, you must attack the Undead. You gain +1 SL to all combat Tests versus them and you are immune to Fear and Intimidate (but not Terror) caused by the Undead.
talent.name: Hatred - Undead

talent.description: You posses talent River Guide or Gunner.
talent.name: River Guide or Gunner

talent.description: You can make a Challenging (+0) Leadership Test to help the crew. If successful, the crew members may use your Ranged Skill when shooting the weapon.
talent.name: Crew Commander
talent.tests: Ranged Skill tests when firing a weapon with the Crewed Flaw

talent.name: Etiquette - Guilder - Cartographer

talent.name: Master Tradesman - Cartography

talent.name: Fearless - Chaos
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Chaos enemies' Intimidate, Fear, and Terror

talent.description: Allows to act like you belong among Mercenaries.
talent.name: Etiquette - Mercenary

talent.description: If you successfully pass an Average (+20%) Cool Test you can ignore any Intimidate, Fear, or Terror effects from Cavalry.
talent.name: Fearless - Cavalry
talent.tests: Cool to oppose Intimidate, Fear, and Terror caused by Cavalry units

talent.description: Add the Trade - Alchemy Skill to any Career you enter. If the Career already has that Trade - Alchemy, you can obtain it for 5 XP fewer per Advance.
talent.name: Craftsman - Alchemy

talent.name: Etiquette - Guilder - Alchemy

talent.name: Resistance - Poison or Disease

talent.description: Those with Second Sight see red wind around you. You gain benefits of Frenzy Talent and can use Channelling - Aqshy skill in place of WP for the purposes of entering Frenzy. All successful spell casts (within 8 yards) from the Lore of Fire receive +1 SL. This bonus applies only once, even if there are multiple people with Suffused with Aqshy within 8 yards.
talent.name: Suffused With Aqshy

All successful spell casts (within 8 yards) from the Lore of Heavens receive +1 SL. This bonus applies only once, even if there are multiple people with Suffused with Azyr within 8 yards.
talent.name: Suffused With Azyr

talent.description: Those with Second Sight see golden wind around you. You can use Channelling - Chamon skill in place of Evaluate skill for any Test. All successful spell casts (within 8 yards) from the Lore of Metal receive +1 SL. This bonus applies only once, even if there are multiple people with Suffused with Chamon within 8 yards.
talent.name: Suffused With Chamon

talent.description: Those with Second Sight see amber wind around you. You can use Channelling - Ghur skill in place of Evaluate skill for any Test. All successful spell casts (within 8 yards) from the Lore of Beasts receive +1 SL. This bonus applies only once, even if there are multiple people with Suffused with Ghur within 8 yards.
talent.name: Suffused With Ghur

talent.description: Those with Second Sight see jade wind around you. You can use Channelling - Ghyran skill in place of  Lore - Plants, Animals, Herbs skill for any Test. All successful spell casts (within 8 yards) from the Lore of Life receive +1 SL. This bonus applies only once, even if there are multiple people with Suffused with Ghyran within 8 yards.
talent.name: Suffused With Ghyran

talent.description: Those with Second Sight see white wind around you. You can use Channelling - Hysh skill in place of Research skill for any Test. All successful spell casts (within 8 yards) from the Lore of Light receive +1 SL. This bonus applies only once, even if there are multiple people with Suffused with Hysh within 8 yards.
talent.name: Suffused With Hysh

talent.description: Those with Second Sight see purple wind around you. You can use Channelling - Shyish skill in place of Intimidate skill for any Test. All successful spell casts (within 8 yards) from the Lore of Death receive +1 SL. This bonus applies only once, even if there are multiple people with Suffused with Shyish within 8 yards.
talent.name: Suffused With Shyish

talent.description: This particular Talent is exclusive to Power Familiars and is not available to other characters. The familiar can help its wizard with any Channelling, Lore - Magic, or Language - Magick Tests, as well as Research Tests that pertain to magical advancements or discoveries. This assistance provides a +20 bonus to these Tests.
talent.name: Magical Assistant
talent.tests: Wizards's Channelling, Lore - Magic, or Language - Magick Tests

talent.description: You are suffused with one of the Winds of Magic. All successful spell casts (within 8 yards) from the lore associated with the wind get +1 SL. This bonus applies only once, even if there are multiple people with Suffused with Wind within 8 yards.
talent.name: Suffused with Wind

talent.description: Your size is large instead of Average.
talent.name: Large

talent.description: You suffer from the Vice Psychology. You constantly obsess about your Vice. Every time you encounter target of your Vice you must pass a Psychology Test or you will indulge in your vice and abandon all other actions. Each time you take this Talent you develop a new vice.
talent.name: Vice

talent.description: Pass automatically the first test against any ingested poison. The SL of such test is your TB.
talent.name: Resistance - Poison (Ingested)
talent.tests: All those to resist ingested poison

talent.description: You constantly obsess about Food. Every time you encounter food you must pass a Psychology Test or you will start eating uncontrollably and abandon all other actions.
talent.name: Vice - Food

talent.description:
On encountering Chaos creature, you must attempt a Psychology Test. If failed you are subject to Hatred. You can attempt Psychology Test at the end of every subsequent Round to stop the Hatred.
While subject to Hatred, you must attack the Chaos creature. You gain +1 SL to all combat Tests versus them and you are immune to Fear and Intimidate (but not Terror) caused by them.
talent.name: Hatred - Chaos

talent.description: You can use Entertain - Sing instead of Channeling when performing a Channelling Test. Any user within Fel yards can siphon off a single SL from your Extended Channelling Test per round. You can also perform Entertain - Sing Test specifically to help another wizard's Channelling Test even if you cannot cast spells yourself.
talent.name: Cantor

talent.description:
Every time you take this Talent, select a faction (Orcs, Goblins, Skaven, etc.). The become target of your vengeance. Every time you win a significant victory against that group you gain 50 XP.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.

talent.description:
After activating the Pummel Quality, you inflict an additional Stunned Condition for each level this Talent.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.

talent.description:
When attacking using weapon with Hack quality reduce enemy cover by 1 level (hard to medium, etc.). After activating Hack, gain + 1 Damage on struck armour or shields for each level of this Talent.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.

talent.tests: Melee when breaking inanimate objects using a Hack weapon

talent.description:
When firing Blackpowder weapon, enemies who fail Cool Test gain 1 extra Broken Condition for each level of this Talent.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.
talent.name: Dragon Belcher

talent.description:
When in soft cover, attacks against you are Hard (-20) instead of Difficult (-10). When in medium cover, attacks are Very Hard (-30) instead of Hard (-20).
Unique to Dwarf Characters.
talent.name: Entrenchment

talent.description:
When Engaged, you and allies within WP Bonus yards gain Penetrating Quality. If an affected weapon is already Penetrating, its attacks now ignore 1 additional point of non-metal armour. 
Unique to Dwarf Characters.
talent.name: Forgefire

talent.description:
After receiving Unconscious Condition, you can  immediately make a Melee attack as a Free Action, before you are taken out of action.
In case of Stunned Condition, you can spend a Fortune point to do it.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.

talent.description:
When inflicting a Critical Hit with a Crossbow weapon, add +10 per Talent rank to Critical Hit table roll, up to a maximum of 100. Crossbow bolts lodged in due to Impale Quality, reduce target's Movement by 1 per bolt, to a minimum of 1.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.

talent.description:
Any enemy attacks against an ally within 2 yards of you suffers a -10 modifier for each level of Kingsguard. Talent has no effect if you are currently suffering from a Condition.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.

talent.description:
Gain +10 to S and T after consuming alcoholic drink that lasts 1 hour. Drinking more, prolongs the effect but does not increase Characteristics above +10.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.
talent.name: Liquid Fortification

talent.description:
You never forget anything. You can perfectly recall time, date, location, and  faces etc. See detailed description in Dwarf Player's Guide p. 82.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.

talent.description:
You can Reverse any Test you need to make as part of a spellâ€™s effects, as well as Tests to dispel magic with Magic Resistance.

Do not suffer penalties for attacking while having Prone Condition or being beneath the opponent. Enemies do not get a bonus to attack you whilst you have the Prone Condition. Gain extra +20 to hit Surprised enemies when emerging from a tunnel, pit, or other hidden position below them.
Unique to Dwarf Characters.

mutation.name: Rotting Flesh

mutation.description: Gain the Distracting Creature Trait. Cannot be hidden.
mutation.name: Shifting Colours

mutation.description: Gain the Fear 2 Creature Trait. Can only be hidden by clothing.
mutation.name: Skull Face

mutation.description: Gain +1 Armour Points on all locations. Gain a Free Attack (Weapon +4 Creature Trait) when Charging. You can no longer wear armour. Cannot be hidden.
mutation.name: Spiked Skin

mutation.description: Gain the Wallcrawler Creature Trait. Can only be hidden by clothing.
mutation.name: Suckered Hands and Feet

mutation.description: Gain the Tail Attack +3 Creature Trait. Can only be hidden by clothing.
mutation.name: Tail

mutation.description: Gain the Acute Sense - Vision Talent. Can only be hidden by clothing.
mutation.name: Three Eyes

mutation.description: Gain the Fear 2 Creature Trait. Cannot be hidden.
mutation.name: Transparent Skin

mutation.description: Gain the Ambidextrous Talent. Cannot be hidden.
mutation.name: Two Heads

mutation.description: Your skin has a strange colour or texture. Cannot be hidden.
mutation.name: Unusual Skin

mutation.description: Gain the Frenzy Creature Trait. Anytime you are under influence of Frenzy, temporarily gain another random physical mutation.
mutation.name: Warp Frenzy

mutation.description: Gain the Amphibious Creature Trait. Can only be hidden by clothing.
mutation.name: Webbed Feet

mutation.description: Pus is coming from your head.
mutation.name: Weeping Pus - Head

mutation.description: Pus is coming from your left arm.
mutation.name: Weeping Pus - Left Arm

mutation.description: Pus is coming from your right arm.
mutation.name: Weeping Pus - Right Arm.

mutation.description: Pus is coming from your left leg.
mutation.name: Weeping Pus - Left Leg

mutation.description: Pus is coming from your right leg.
mutation.name: Weeping Pus - Right Leg

mutation.description: Gain the Flight 60 Creature Trait. Can only be hidden by clothing.
mutation.name: Wings

mutation.description: Gain the Witch! Talent. Suffer -5 Fel and -5 Int.
mutation.name: Aethyric Leak

mutation.description: Gain the Bestial Creature Trait for 1d10 hours if you fail a WP related test.
mutation.name: Animalistic Psyche

mutation.description:
Whenever subject to Psychology, gain the Corruption (Minor)
Creature Trait. Suffer -10 Fel.
mutation.name: Beacon of Corruption

mutation.description: Gain the Painless Creature Trait. Suffer -20 I and -20 Int.
mutation.name: Beyond Pain

mutation.description: Gain the Hatred (Religion) Creature Trait. Gain +10 WP.
mutation.name: Blasphemous Soul

mutation.description: Every time you would take a Broken Condition, gain Immunity to Psychology Creature Trait for 1d10 Rounds instead. Afterwards take 1d10 Broken Conditions.
mutation.name: Blasted Mind

mutation.description: Gain the Hatred (Target) Creature Trait. Once a day, roll on the Fixations Table (Enemy in Shadows Companion p. 69) to determine target for that day.
mutation.name: Fitful Hatred

mutation.description: Gain a Fatigued Condition every week you do not gain a Corruption Point or are not responsible for someone else gaining it. Lose all Fatigued Conditions if either situation occurs.
mutation.name: Glorious Corruption

mutation.description: Every time you fail a WP related Test, gain the Malaise Symptom for 1d10 hours.
mutation.name: Hounds of Despair

mutation.description: Gain the Belligerent Creature Trait. You cannot Flee voluntarily.
mutation.name: Hurried Masochism

mutation.description: Every time you interact with filth, gain the Nausea Symptom for 1d10 hours.
mutation.name: Lingering Foulness

mutation.description: Suffer -10 Int. Gain +10 WP. When alone, Gain the Stupid Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Mindless Wandering

mutation.description: Gain + 10 I. Gain the Skittish Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Monstrous Paranoia

mutation.description: Suffer -10 WP. Gain +10 Ag.
mutation.name: Panicked Urgency

mutation.description: Gain the Hungry Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Ravenous Hunger

mutation.description: Every time you fail a Willpower related Test, gain the Convulsions Symptom for 1d10 hours.
mutation.name: Soul Sickness

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Inanimate Objects) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Inanimate Objects

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Poverty) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Poverty

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Fire) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Fire

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Figures/Symbols of War) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Figures/Symbols of War

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Figures/Symbols of Authority) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Figures/Symbols of Authority

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Figures/Symbols of Religion) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Figures/Symbols of Religion

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Monsters) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Monsters

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Mutants) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Mutants

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Halflings) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Halflings

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Humans) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Humans

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Dwarfs) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Dwarfs

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Elves) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Elves

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Wild Animals) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Wild Animals

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Domestic Animals) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Domestic Animals

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Magic) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Magic

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Sickness) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Sickness

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Water) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Water

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Affluence) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Affluence

mutation.description: Gain the Afraid (Happiness) Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Terrible Phobia - Happiness

mutation.description: Your legs now resemble the hind legs of a goat. Gain +1 Movement. Can only be hidden by clothing. Requires difficult (-10) Athletics Test to walk with a normal gait.
mutation.name: Animalistic Legs - Goat

mutation.description: Lose 20 Fel and 10 Int. Gain the Acute Sense - Smell Talent.
mutation.name: Bestial Face - Dog

mutation.description: Gain the Fear 3 Creature Trait. Lose -20 Fel.
mutation.name: Rotting Flesh - v2

mutation.description: Lose -40 Int, to a minimum of 10. Gain the Stupid Creature Trait.
mutation.name: Pin Head - v2

mutation.description:
Lose -5 Int and -10 Fel. Gain +1 Armour point to
your Head Hit Location. Headwear only fits if specially crafted.
mutation.name: Pointed Head - v2

mutation.description:
Lose -5 Int and -10 Fel. Gain +1 Armour point to
your Head Hit Location. Headwear only fits if specially crafted.
mutation.name: Pointed Head - v2 - copy

mutation.description: Lose -10 Dex and -10 Fel. Gain +1 Armour Points to all locations. This AP may not be used for Critical Deflection.
mutation.name: Thorny Scales - v2

mutation.description: You have new eyes. Roll 1d100 to determine their Hit Location. Gain +1d10 I. If you have no I Characteristic, gain +3d10 I instead. All hits the the Hit Location with your new eyes inflict a Blinded Condition.
mutation.name: Clutch of Eyes

mutation.description: Your head to stretches in wide translucent folds around your swollen, glowing brain. Gain +1d10 Int.  If you have no Int Characteristic, gain +3d10 I instead.  All Head Hits cause a Critical Wound.
mutation.name: Massive Intelect

mutation.description: You suffer -20 to all Tests requiring you to hold something and -20 to Fel Tests. When escaping Grapple, if you succeed, you can use unit die number as SL.
mutation.name: Slippery Skin

mutation.description: With a successful Willpower Test, you can mentally communicate with any sentient creature within WP yards. If you succeed an Opposed Willpower Test, you can read creature's surface thoughts.
mutation.name: Telepathy

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
+1 Damage for each Rune of Cleaving.
rune.name: Rune of Cleaving

rune.description:
SLs Required: 12
You may add +20 to rolls on a Critical Wound table for each Rune of Retribution.
rune.name: Rune of Retribution

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
You may ignore 2 APs of armour per Rune of Cutting on successful hits.
rune.name: Rune of Cutting

rune.description:
SLs Required: 14
Whilst drawing the weapon with this rune, you gain the Fear Creature Trait. Your Fear Rating is equal to the number of Runes of Daunting. If you already have
a Fear Rating, increase by +1 for each Rune of Daunting.
rune.name: Rune of Daunting

rune.description:
SLs Required: 16
Whilst drawing the weapon with this rune, its blade bursts into flames, providing 20 yards of illumination, and inflicting 1 Ablaze Condition on enemies it inflicts damage upon.
A weapon with two or three Runes of Fire can be used to make ranged attacks using BS, with a Range equal to the wielderâ€™s WP Bonus, and the Blast 4 Quality. This attack deals no Damage, but inflicts 1 Ablaze Condition for each Rune of Fire.
rune.name: Rune of Fire

rune.description:
SLs Required: 15
Gain 1 level of Dual Wielder for each Rune of Fury (this may go over the Talent 
maximum levels).
For purposes of activating Dual Wielder, you may count a weapon bearing the Rune of Fury as two separate weapons, one in each hand, allowing you to attack two targets even if you arenâ€™t carrying a second weapon.
rune.name: Rune of Fury

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
Nominate an enemy you bear a Blood Grudge. For each Grudge Rune, the weapon gains +10 to hit and +1 Damage on attacks against the nominated enemy. At the end of the adventure, if your the enemy is slain, you may nominate a new one.
rune.name: Grudge Rune

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
When attacking target larger than yourself, the weapon deals +3 Damage for each Rune of Might.
rune.name: Rune of Might

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
Gain +10 Initiative for each Rune of Speed.
rune.name: Rune of Speed

rune.description:
SLs Required: 14
When attacking with a weapon with this rune, gain +10 to Melee Skill (appropriate for the weapon with the rune) for each Rune of Striking.
rune.name: Rune of Striking

rune.description:
SLs Required: 30
This weapon ignores the targetâ€™s AP, the targetâ€™s armour Qualities, and any other benefits provided by the targetâ€™s armour.
rune.name: Master Rune of Alaric the Mad

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
When you win a Opposed Melee Test (either as attacked or defender) any magic weapon used by your opponent during their Melee Test is destroyed.
rune.name: Master Rune of Breaking

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
The weapon can be used as a Thrown ranged weapon, with a Range of SBx3. It gains the Accurate Quality, and returns to your hand after inflicting Damage.
rune.name: Master Rune of Flight

rune.description:
SLs Required: 28
Any successful attack with this weapon counts as scoring a Critical.
rune.name: Master Rune of Skalf Blackhammer

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
Choose a specific type of enemy: Daemons, Undead, etc. When attacking
that enemy of this type, you may Reverse any attack Tests, and Reverse any rolls they make on a Critical Wound table.
rune.name: Master Rune of the Slayer

rune.description:
SLs Required: 22
Any failed Melee Tests made always count a success with 0 SL. The only way the attack can fail is when the target scores more SLs on their Opposed Test.
rune.name: Master Rune of Snorri Spangelhelm

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
The weapon gains an improved version Fast Quality. All Melee Tests to defend against it suffer a penalty of -30 (instead of -10).
rune.name: Master Rune of Haste

rune.description:
SLs Required: 14
If you make a successful Melee attack as part of a Charge, you inflict bonus Damage for each Rune of Impact equal to the APs of your most armoured location.
rune.name: Rune of Force

rune.description:
SLs Required: 14
Gain +10 T for each Rune of Fortitude.
rune.name: Rune of Fortitude

rune.description:
SLs Required: 12
Gain +2 Wounds for each Rune of Iron. These Wounds are lost when the armour is removed, which can trigger a Critical Wound.
rune.name: Rune of Iron

rune.description:
SLs Required: 12
For each Rune of Resistance, gain +10 to Tests to Oppose an incoming Melee attack.
rune.name: Rune of Resistance

rune.description:
SLs Required: 12
Incoming ranged attacks and spells reduce have their Damage reduced by 2 for each Rune of Shielding.
rune.name: Rune of Shielding

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
The armour gains +1 AP for each Rune of Stone. Suits with one or more Runes of Stone, and no other runes, are exempt from the Rule of Pride - they continue to function even if identical suits of runic armour enters 100 yards.
rune.name: Rune of Stone

rune.description:
SLs Required: 22
You may Reverse the roll on the Critical Wound table.
rune.name: Master Rune of Adamant

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
The armour loses the Weakpoints Flaw, can never be Damaged except by a Runic Flaw, and never reduces its AP due to Talents or effects such as the Penetrating Quality.
rune.name: Master Rune of Gromril

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
You can only suffer a maximum of 10 Wounds from any single source when Damage is inflicted.
rune.name: Master Rune of Steel

rune.description:
SLs Required: 8
When the talisman is pressed to your eye, you ignore any penalties imposed by non-magical vapours such as fog, clouds, mist, etc. Two Runes of Clear Seeing also penetrate magical vapours. With three Runes of Clear Seeing you to see clearly in total darkness.
rune.name: Rune of Clear Sight

rune.description: Perception Tests made using lens with this Rune are not affected by the rules for Visibility. It does not allow to see through illusions but reveals these as magical by tinting them greenish.
rune.name: Rune of Clear Sight - v2

rune.description:
SLs Required: 8
The talisman glows brightly if pressed into contact with an item that has been faked, forged, counterfeited, or deliberately degraded in value. Two Runes of Disclosure also identify magical illusions or duplicates. Three Runes of Disclosure reveal the precise method of deception to the bearer.
rune.name: Rune of Truth

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
When the talisman is pressed to the userâ€™s eye, it magnifies the vision. It allows to see clearly  up to a mile away. Two runes extend it to 2 miles and three rune to 4 miles.
rune.name: Rune of Far Sight

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
You are immune to heat. You do not acquire the Ablaze Condition and reduce all incoming Damage from fire and flaming attacks by 4 for each Rune of the Furnace.
rune.name: Rune of the Furnace

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
Gain 1 Fortune point for each Rune of Luck. This can exceed your usual maximum Fortune. When you remove the talisman, you lose these extra points
(to a minimum of 0), and cannot regain them until the following session.
rune.name: Rune of Luck

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
After a good nightâ€™s sleep, regain Toughness Bonus in Wounds for
each Rune of Restoration.
rune.name: Rune of Restoration

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
When using the Magic Resistance Talent, you can activate this rune to automatically count as rolling 01 on your WP Test. You can activate each Rune of
Spellbreaking once per adventure, and must choose to activate it before you roll.
rune.name: Rune of Spellbreaking

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
After a successful dispel with Magic Resistance Talent, the spellcaster cannot
cast the spell again for number of Rounds equal to your WP Bonus. Two Runes of Spelleating extend the effect from Rounds to Hours and three runes extend it to weeks.
rune.name: Rune of Spelleating

rune.description:
SLs Required: 15
Attack and spellcasting Tests targeting you suffer -10 penalty for each Rune of Warding.
rune.name: Rune of Warding

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
When an enemy within line of sight casts a spell, you may either Reverse their Spellcasting Test, or Reverse your Opposed WP Test.
rune.name: Master Rune of Balance

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
You may take an extra Endeavour between adventures.
rune.name: Master Rune of Industry

rune.description:
SLs Required: 24
You may Reverse any Charm, Intimidate, and Leadership Tests you make that target a Dwarf, or a group mostly consisting of Dwarfs.
rune.name: Master Rune of Kingship

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
When Moving at walking pace, you can Move through solid, immobile objects like trees, rock, and metal. You cannot Move through creatures (living or Undead). You have to finish your Move outside of the object.
rune.name: Master Rune of Passage

rune.description:
SLs Required: 24
Every time you take any damage, the attacker suffers 2d10 Damage to a random location reduced by T Bonus and AP as usual.
rune.name: Master Rune of Spite

rune.description:
SLs Required: 8
Item with this rune emits a loud, blaring noise if any creature of Size Small or larger enters its range of effect. With 2 runes, it can emit a pre-recorded message instead. With 3 runes it can transmit a  telepathic message to the creator or their closest living descendant, over any distance.
rune.name: Rune of Alarm

rune.description:
SLs Required: 18
Affected allies begin combat with 1 Advantage for each Rune of Battle.
rune.name: Rune of Battle

rune.description:
SLs Required: 14
Affected allies gain +10 on Psychology Tests for each Rune of Courage.
rune.name: Rune of Courage

rune.description:
SLs Required: 8
For each Rune of Discovery, the crafter chooses a specific metal or gem (e.g. gold, diamond, gromril). The runic item glows brightly if that material is within its range of effect.
rune.name: Rune of Discovery

rune.description:
SLs Required: 6
This rune can be used to protect locks. One rune makes the lock immune to being picked or forced except by magic or the corresponding key. Two runes make it immune to magic effects as well. With three runes, the lock cannot be unlocked even with  the lockâ€™s corresponding key.  Only the crafter, or their closest living descendant, can open the lock.
rune.name: Rune of Locking

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
Affected allies gain +20 for each Rune of Purification on Tests to resist toxins in air and water.
rune.name: Rune of Purification

rune.description:
SLs Required: 8
Anything that violates the sanctity of dead bodies within range of effect (for example stealing from the dead or casting a necromantic spell), they immediately gain 1 Ablaze Condition for each Rune of Retribution.
rune.name: Rune of Retribution

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
Affected allies gain +10 per rune to WP Tests to dispel with Magic Resistance Talent.
rune.name: Rune of Sanctuary

rune.description:
SLs Required: 12
Enemies engaging affected allies reduce the distance they can Run by 4 yards per Rune of Slowness, to a minimum of equal to the enemyâ€™s Walk distance.
rune.name: Rune of Slowness

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
All Rodents (Skaven, Rat Ogres, etc.) lose 2 Wounds (ignoring T Bonus and APs) for each Rune of Verminkill when they enter the area of effect, or start their Turn within it.
rune.name: Rune of Verminkill

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
When fighting with a Daemonic enemy that has the Unstable Trait, affected allies have +2 Advantage when calculating Wounds lost for being Unstable.
Allies withing the area of effect may Reverse any Test to resist corruption, Tests to avoid mutation from Corruption, and rolls on the Physical and Mental Corruption Tables.
rune.name: Master Rune of Expel Chaos

rune.description:
SLs Required: 22
You may Reverse any enemy spellcasting Tests made against affected allies.
rune.name: Master Rune of Grimnir

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
Affected allies begin combat with 1 Advantage. The range of this rune is 12 yards, or 24 yards if forged upon a battle standard.
rune.name: Master Rune of Stromni Redbeard

rune.description:
SLs Required: 22
Allies within the area of effect can use Magic Resistance Talent without limit restrictions, it can be used against any target in their line of sight. In addition, it can be used to dispel persistent spells and they may reverse any WP Test to Oppose spellcasting with it.
rune.name: Master Rune of Valaya

rune.description:
SLs Required: 14
Gain +10 to hit for each Rune of Accuracy.
rune.name: Rune of Accuracy

rune.description:
SLs Required: 16
Anything struck by this weapon gains 1 Ablaze Condition per Rune of Burning.
rune.name: Rune of Burning

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
The crew might activate this rune after Fumble and/or Misfire to negate the effects. Each Rune of Forging can be activated once per adventure.
rune.name: Rune of Forging

rune.description:
SLs Required: 14
The weapon inflicts +2 Damage for each Rune of Penetrating
rune.name: Rune of Penetrating

rune.description:
SLs Required: 12
Each rune reduces weapon's Reload Rating by 2. If this would reduce the Rating to 0 or below, the weapon loses the Reload Flaw. Weapons with the Salvo
Quality cannot be reduced below Reload Rating 1.
rune.name: Rune of Reloading

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
Gain +20 to hit for each Rune of Seeking when attacking a flying enemy.
rune.name: Rune of Seeking

rune.description:
SLs Required: 14
Weapon's Dwarf crew starts combat with 1 Advantage for each Rune of the Stalwart. This extra Advantage is lost by any Characters that leave the crew, or become Engaged in melee.
rune.name: Rune of the Stalwart

rune.description:
SLs Required: 10
Dwarf crew of this weapon gain +10 WP for each Rune of the Valiant.
rune.name: Rune of the Valiant

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
The weapon's crew always count as being in hard cover. Ranged attacks against them suffer -30 penalty.
rune.name: Master Rune of Defence

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
The weapon is invisible to all enemies until it fires for the first time. It stays visible for the rest of the fight. The crew remain visible as normal, and moving the machine still causes noise.
rune.name: Master Rune of Disguise

rune.description:
SLs Required: 20
Any Dwarf crew member can use Free Action to activate this rune and trigger self-destruction of the weapon. All creatures withing 6 yards take 
All creatures within 6 yards  take 15 Damage (reduced by T Bonus and APs) to a random location and gain Ablaze Condition.
rune.name: Master Rune of Immolation

rune.description:
SLs Required: 22
You can activate this rune to automatically roll 01 on the next attack. If the attack is successful it also counts as Critical and you may chose the location.
It can be activated once per adventure, and must decide to activate it before you roll.
rune.name: Master Rune of Skewering

rune.description: All Dwarfs within 25 yards of the Anvil of Doom automatically roll 01 on any Cool Tests they make until the end of the next Round.
rune.name: Rune of Hearth and Home

rune.description: All Dwarfs within 25 yards of the Anvil of Doom gain +2 AP to the armour they are wearing, until the end of the next Round.
rune.name: Rune of Oath and Steel

rune.description: Deals 12 Damage (reduced by T Bonus and APs) to a random location to all enemies within 25 yards of the Anvil of Doom.
rune.name: Rune of Wrath and Ruin

rune.description: The weapon gains Impact quality against Orcs, Goblins, Snotlings, and Hobgoblins.  Goblins treat the bearer as having the Fear 1 Creature Trait.
rune.name: Rune of Goblin Bane

rune.description: Provides bearer with Bounce Creature Trait.
rune.name: Rune of Leaping

rune.description: Any harmful spell that targets weapon's bearer, suffers -2 SL.
rune.name: Rune of Spell-Breaking

rune.description: Bearer gains +2 SL to Cool Tests to resist Fear and Terror.
rune.name: Rune of Stalwart - v2

rune.description: Add 40 to the score of any Critical Hits you make to the head.
rune.name: Smednir's Master Rune of Head-Wrecking

skill.description: Ability to make and understand clandestine  signs known only to a closed group.
skill.name: Secret Signs

skill.description: You have vast knowledge of witches.
skill.name: Lore - Witches

skill.description: Proficiency at riding animals.
skill.name: Ride

skill.description: You have a broad knowledge and possibly a formal training in botany.
skill.name: Lore - Plants

skill.description: You have a broad knowledge of geography, history, people, and culture of a particular area.
skill.name: Lore - Local

skill.description: Ability to speak a particular language other  than native one.
skill.name: Language

skill.description: You can play an instrument. The SL of the Play Test shows how much others like your performance.
skill.name: Play

skill.description: Ability to handle alcohol without  suffering its negative consequences.
skill.name: Consume Alcohol

skill.description: Allows to quickly find useful gossips and spread rumors efficiently.
skill.name: Gossip

skill.description:
You can recognize the most subtle signs that allows you to follow others.
This Skill can be also used to hide your own trail. Whoever is following you will have to take Track Test Opposed by your Track Test.
Tracking usually requires an Extended Test with the Difficulty modified by factors such as: how fresh the trail is, etc.
GM my chose to use Pursuit rules to check if you are able to track down a fleeing animal.
skill.name: Track

skill.description: Allows to care for animals, and heal them.
skill.name: Animal Care

skill.description:
You can swim. Swimming in calm water does not need a Test to succeed.
The test is required if there are any adverse conditions such as: currents, cold water, extra encumbrance, etc.
In combat, Swim is used when fighting in the water (deep). It replaces skills like Athletics to govern Movement. Your swim speed is half of your Movement speed.
skill.name: Swim

skill.description: You have a broad knowledge of geography, history, people, and culture of Altdorf.
skill.name: Lore - Local - Altdorf

skill.description:
By having a level in this Skill, you are automatically assumed to be able to row in calm water.
The Row Skill Test is usually necessary when rowing in some adverse conditions or racing.
skill.name: Row

skill.description: You have a vast knowledge of culture and history of Dwarfs in the Old World.
skill.name: Lore - Dwarfs

skill.description: You have a broad knowledge and possibly a formal training in engineering.
skill.name: Lore - Engineering

skill.description: Ability to use and understand secret Miner markings.
skill.name: Secret Signs - Miner

skill.description: You have a broad knowledge of etiquette.
skill.name: Lore - Etiquette

skill.description: Training and experience with the weapons from Flail group.
skill.name: Melee - Flail

skill.description:
Your ability to operate a Cog or a similar ship. You are automatically presumed to be able to sail in calm water. 
Test is usually necessary when sailing in adverse conditions or racing.
You can use Sail as a basic Skill with any other Specialisations.
skill.name: Sail - Cog

skill.description:
Lets you look into the future. This can be done in a few different ways:
Priests and Sisters receive prophetic visions.
Celestial Wizards read future from the stars.
Mystics use tools such as cards or dice.
Consulting the Thaumodivinator in Altdorf.
Consorting with Daemons. 
You can make a single Augury Test one per day.
