item.description: Just a larger piece of wood. Players in wooded areas can take a Extended Challenging (+0) Outdoor Survival Test requiring a total of 7 SL to find one.
item.name: Club

item.description: Metal shaft with a heave head. Less balanced that a sword but inflicts concussive blows.
item.name: Mace

item.description: Basically a metal spike on a stick. Not as agile as sword but good for piercing armor.
item.name: Military Pick

item.description: A curved blade good for slashing.
item.name: Scimitar

item.description: A regular sword. Well balanced.
item.name: Sword

item.description: Is flat and heavy on one side for pummelling damage and has a spike on another for penetrating damage.
item.name: Warhammer

item.description: A large round wooden shield designed to protect crossbowmen during reload. It costs 2 Actions to set up. After setting up, if the character stays 1 yard behind the Pavise, it has Shield 5 Quality against projectiles. In case of melee attack it provides Shield 5 protection only in the first turn of combat.
item.name: Pavise

item.description: Smaller version of Lance. If used by attacker without Charging, it count as Improvised Weapon (SB+1 Damage, Undamaging).
item.name: Demi-Lance

item.description: Curved blade similar to Scimitar but a bit more straight and longer. Can be used on foot with Melee - Basic skill but with Slash (2A) instead of Slash (1A) or with Melee - Fencing in which case it retains Slash (1A) Quality.
item.name: Sabre

item.description: A smaller version of the foil. Often not considered a serious weapon. When used in sports contest, it has blunt tips and blades in which case it gains Undamaging Flaw.
item.name: Smallsword

item.description: Gauntlet with spikes. Can be part of a plate armor, in that case it does not add extra Encumbrance.
item.name: Spiked Gauntlet

item.description: A piece of wire intended to be slipped around one's neck. Can be made in a coaching inn or urban location by passing and extended Challenging (+0) Trade (Chandler, Engineer, Tailor, or Tanner) Test requiring a total of 5 SL.
item.name: Garrote

item.description: Gauntlet that ensure that the wielder does not drop a weapon held in the gauntleted hand. If character is forced to drop the weapon, they suffer -20 penalty to any Tests made with that item. Can be part of a plate armor, in that case it does not add extra Encumbrance.
item.name: Locked Gauntlet

item.description: A leather sheath with some small heavy items, for example musket balls. Can be made in a tavern, shop, or urban location by passing and extended Challenging (+0) Trade (Carpenter, Engineer, Smith, Tailor or Tanner) Test requiring a total of 15 SL.
item.name: Sap

item.description:
When making a Test to see if an opponent becomes entangled
in a weighted net, the net has a Strength of 55.
item.name: Weighted Net

item.description: A long thin spike on top of a spear shaft.
item.name: Ahlspiess

item.description: A hooked blade on a long shaft.
item.name: Bill

item.description: A Polearm with a semi-circular top with spikes on the inner side. Can be used to trap someone's neck.
item.name: Mancatcher

item.description: A Polearm with a semi-circular top with spikes on the inner side. Can be used to trap someone's neck. Has an extra spring-loaded mechanism that gives bonus of +20 to any Strength Tests made to entangle.
item.name: Mancatcher (spring-loaded)

item.description: A spear with a thick leaf shaped blade.
item.name: Partizan (Glaive)

item.description: Polearm with short spike on the top for Impale, an axe head to one side for Hack, and a hammer head on the other side for Pummel.
item.name: Pollaxe

item.description: A type of longsword. It is a great sword with two-handed grip, usually 5 ft long, and weighing over 4 lb. The blade has waves and serrated edges making it even more deadly.
item.name: Flamberge Zweihander

item.description: The arrowhead has extra hooks that cause deeper wounds.
item.name: Barbed Arrow

item.description: Special arrowhead designed to penetrate armor.
item.name: Bodkin Arrow

item.description: A sharp stick that can be used instead as arrow. Can be sourced in wooded locations by passing an extended Challenging (+0) Outdoor Survival Test requiring a total of 10 SL.
item.name: Sharp Stick

item.description: A pebble that can b used as projectile for a sling. Can be sourced in a suitable location by passing an extended Easy (+40) Outdoor Survival Test or an extended Challenging (+0) Perception Test requiring a total of 5 SL.
item.name: Pebble

item.description: Early design of a handgun. Before shooting, the user has to spend 1 Action to light the fuse.
item.name: Matchlock Handgun

item.description: Early design of a handgun. Before shooting, the user has to spend 1 Action to light the fuse.
item.name: Matchlock Blunderbuss

item.description: A very early design of a gun fired from the shoulder. Not very practical, usually kept by nobles seeking to impress visitors.
item.name: Arquebus

item.description: A handgun with 2 barrels and 2 triggers. Comes with a device for reloading both barrels at once.
item.name: Double-barrelled Handgun

item.description: Shoots 6 projectiles at a time. Reloading is very difficult and requires 6 bullets and doses of gunpowder.
item.name: Griffonsfoot Pistol

item.description: Can we used as Axe with Melee - Basic Skill. If used as an axe while loaded, any critical fumble will discharge the weapon into the torso of the user.
item.name: Gun Axe

item.description: Can we used as Halberd with Melee - Polearm Skill. If used as an axe while loaded, any critical fumble will discharge the weapon into anyone unlucky enough to be standing directly behind the user.
item.name: Gun Halberd

item.description: A simpler form of a Repeater Pistol. After each shot it has to be manually rotated, cranked, or otherwise manually prepared to fire again. Because of that it needs a second hand to operate or it loses its Repeater Quality.
item.name: Pepperbox

item.description: A scaled down mortar deigned to shoot bombs or other large projectiles.  Any fumble while reloading the weapon causes it to explode.
item.name: Hand Mortar

item.description: A pistol concealed in a walking stick or cane. In order to detect it, one must pass a Hard (-20) Perception Test, or a Very Hard (-30) Perception Test if they are unfamiliar with blackpowder weapons.
item.name: Cane Pistol

item.description: Pre-prepared packages of shot and powder, make reloading easier. Give +10 bonus to all reload Tests.
item.name: Paper Cartridge

item.description: More explosive than normal powder. Any failed Test that includes either an 8 or 9 on either the 10s or units die counts as a Fumble when using this powder.
item.name: Aqshy-Infused Powder

item.description: Extra high quality powder and bullets.
item.name: Precision Shot and Powder

item.description: Made out of really nasty stuff like roofing nails, used horseshoe fragments, arrow heads etc.
item.name: Scrap and Powder

item.description: Can be loaded to large guns such as Arquebus or Hand Mortar. When fired, anyone within 2 yards (including the shooter) has to make Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain a Deafened Condition.
item.name: Large Bullet and Powder

item.description: Can be loaded into Hand Mortar. Fuse must be lit before loading.
item.name: Bomb (Ammunition)

item.description: Can be loaded into Hand Mortar. Fuse must be lit before loading.
item.name: Incendiary (Ammunition)

item.description: Hook with some rope attached. Can be shot from Hand Mortar. May be used to attach a rope to a distant point, or snare an escaping enemy, in which case it inflicts one Entangled Condition on a successful hit.
item.name: Grapple

item.description: Silver bar weighing 1 pound.
item.name: Silver

item.description: A pigâ€™s bladder filled with a volatile lighter-than-air gas.
item.name: Bladder of Liftgas

item.description: Contains enough for 12 horns, which each contain enough for 12 shots.
item.name: Keg of Blackpowder

item.description: Contains enough for 12 horns, which each contain enough for 12 shots. Improved blackpowder reduces reload time by 1 (to a minimum of 1) and allows to make a Challenging (+0) Ranged (Blackpowder or Engineering) Test to ignore the effects of misfire
item.name: Keg of Improved Blackpowder

item.description: A bar of soap.
item.name: Soap

item.description: A small vial of green dye. Enough to change colour of a single set of cloths.
item.name: Dye - Green

item.description: A small vial of yellow dye. Enough to change colour of a single set of cloths.
item.name: Dye - Yellow

item.description: A small vial of red dye. Enough to change colour of a single set of cloths.
item.name: Dye - Red

item.description: A small vial of blue dye. Enough to change colour of a single set of cloths.
item.name: Dye - Blue

item.description: A small vial of purple dye. Enough to change colour of a single set of cloths.
item.name: Dye - Purple

item.description: A small vial of corrosive liquid.
item.name: Vial of Corrosive Liquid

item.description: A small magnet.
item.name: Magnet

item.description: A small chunk of glass. When white light passes through it is split into multiple colours.
item.name: Prism

item.description: 1 yard long. A set of mirrors allowing the user to see from a point of view 1 yard above their had.
item.name: Periscope

item.description: "Average" size ogre club. This one is customised with metal plates around it. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Ogre Club (with Metal Plates)

item.description: "Average" size ogre club. This one is customised with rusty spikes sticking out of it. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Ogre Club (with Rusty Spikes)

item.description: "Average" size ogre club. This one is customised with blades attached to it. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Ogre Club (with Scavenged Blades)

item.description: Massive ogre ironfist. They are tightly attached to user's hand so that user cannot be disarmed. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Ironfist

item.description: Large size ogre club. This one is customised with metal plates around it. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Big Ogre Club (with Metal Plates)

item.description: Large size ogre club. This one is customised with rusty spikes sticking out of it. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Big Ogre Club (with Rusty Spikes)

item.description: Large size ogre club. This one is customised with blades attached to it. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Big Ogre Club (with Scavenged Blades)

item.description: Ogre throwing spear. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Great Throwing Spear

item.description: Essentially a cannon, Leadbelcher Gun is the most advanced Ogre weapon. Breech loaded and fired by lighting a simple fuse. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Leadbelcher Gun

item.description: Large size ore pistol. Uses the same shot and powder as typical blackpowder pistol. It is strong enough to serve as Hand Weapon but it will break on Fumbled attack. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Ogre Pistol

item.description: Ogre launcher that shoots a massive bolts attached to a rope. There is no mechanism to automatically pull back the rope. Can be used with either Ranged - Crossbow or Ranged - Entangling Skills without penalty. If the rope is removed from the bolt, the range increases to 60 but Entangle Quality is lost. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Harpoon Launcher

item.description: Ogre weapon. It is a massive spring-loaded metal jaws attached to a chain. Usable only by large creatures.
item.name: Chain Trap

item.description: Shot for Leadbelcher Gun.
item.name: Leadbelcher Shot

item.description: A cannon ball that can be shot from Leadbelcher Gun. The price includes 2/- worth of powder to fire a single shot. The ball itself can usually be recovered and re-used.
item.name: Leadbelcher Ball

item.description: Ammunition for Ogre Harpoon Launcher.
item.name: Harpoon

item.description: A massive slab of metal, hardwood, bone or leather, it protects the Ogre's belly, where most of their vital organs reside. They are uniquely suited to Ogre anatomy, and indeed even if scaled down, would be no good for other species.
item.name: Ogre Gutplate

item.description: A woollen doublet that is worn under armour. This armour uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Soft Kit

item.description: A woollen doublet that is worn under armour. This armour uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Reinforced Soft Kit

item.description: Boiled leather jacket protecting body and arms. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Leather Jack - v2

item.description: Close-fitting, sleeveless boiled leather jacket. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Leather Jerkin - v2

item.description: Simple boiled leather leg protection. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Leather Leggings - v2

item.description: Boiled leather head protection. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Leather Skullcap - v2

item.description: Chainmail leg armour. Wearing any Mail imposes a  -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Chainmail Chausses - v2

item.description: Chainmail body and arms armour. Wearing any Mail imposes a  -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Chainmail Coat - v2

item.description: Chainmail head armour. It has -10 Perception penalty. Wearing any Mail imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Chainmail Coif - v2

item.description: Chainmail body armour. Does not protect arms. Wearing any Mail imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Chainmail Shirt - v2

item.description: Leather jacket lined internally with small oblong steel plates riveted to the fabric. This armour uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Brigandine Jack

item.description: Close-fitting, sleeveless leather jacket lined internally with small oblong steel plates riveted to the fabric. This armour uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Brigandine Jerkin

item.description: Plate arms armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Bracers - v2

item.description: Plate body armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Breastplate - v2

item.description: Open plate head armour. It imposes -10 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Open Helm - v2

item.description: Plate legs armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Plate Leggings - v2

item.description: Archetypal fully enclosed plate helm. It's considered old fashioned in Tilea and the Empire but still widely used in Bretonnia. It imposes -20 to Perception. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Great Helm

item.description: Plate helmet with conical visor. It provides 4 APs (instead of 3) against projectiles shot at the visor. It imposes -20 to Perception. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Bascinet

item.description: Plate helmet with designed to withstand more blows than other helmets. It imposes -20 to Perception. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Armet

item.description: Plate helmet that provides extra neck protection. It reduces Critical Hit Damage to head area by 1. It imposes -20 to Perception. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Sallet

item.description: Practical wizard robes.These are simple and comfortable costumes that come at an affordable price. They have a plain appearance, making it possible for a wizard dressed in them to blend in unnoticed in various situations.
item.name: Practical Robes

item.description: The standard wizard robes are elaborate costumes that usually consist of thick coats or cloaks and unique headwear.
item.name: Standard Robes

item.description: Elaborate wizard robes are extravagant and cumbersome costumes that often feature oversized accessories and yards of fabric woven with enchanted thread. These robes are not practical to wear and are intended to make a statement. They are easily recognisable as wizard attire and will draw attention to the wearer.
item.name: Elaborate Robes

item.description: Small club made out of obsinite and lined with bronze. Price and availability assumes the weapon is being purchased in Lustria, for example Skeggi or Port Reaver. It is much more expensive and hard to get outside of Lustria.
item.name: Obsinite Club

item.description: Large maul made out of obsinite and lined with bronze. Price and availability assumes the weapon is being purchased in Lustria, for example Skeggi or Port Reaver. It is much more expensive and hard to get outside of Lustria.
item.name: Obsinite Spiked Maul

item.description: Used to shoot poisonous darts. Gains Dangerous Flaw when used without Ranged - blowpipe Skill. Price and availability assumes the weapon is being purchased in Lustria, for example Skeggi or Port Reaver. It is much more expensive and hard to get outside of Lustria.
item.name: Blowpipe

item.description: Blowpipe dart. Usually covered with poison. Price and availability assumes the weapon is being purchased in Lustria, for example Skeggi or Port Reaver. It is much more expensive and hard to get outside of Lustria.
item.name: Blowpipe Dart

item.description: Grassland herb available in autumn. When inhaled (infusion) the target has to pass Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or starts to mildly shake (-20 Dex). When drank (draught), the target receives 2 Poisoned Conditions, resisted with a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test.
item.name: Agurk

item.description: Coniferous forest herb available in summer and autumn. When applied daily to a dislocated or broken bone (as poultice) it halves the usual healing time.
item.name: Alfunas

item.description: Mixed forest herb available in spring and winter. Can be applied once a day to a Festering Wound as poultice. Each time, the target makes an Average (+20) Endurance Test. Reduce the duration of Festering Wound by 1 day for each SL.
item.name: Gesundheit

item.description: Found in Forest clearings and graveyards during autumn and winter. Smeared on the weapon (raw) causes 1 Poisoned Condition to creatures with Undead Trait unless they pass a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test. A poultice of Graveroot applied to Festering Wound caused by Undead with the Infected Trait adds +20 to all Tests against the Festering Wound. Can be applied once per day. When ingested as draught, it makes the body cold in touch for 1d10+2 hours.
item.name: Graveroot

item.description: Forest herb available during spring. 1d10 minutes after contact with its juice (raw), the affected area becomes itchy for 2d10 + 40 minutes causing -20 to all Tests. The target can make a Challenging (+0) WP Test to ignore the itching for 10 * (1 + SL) minutes, totally negating the penalty with 2 or more SLs. It can also be applied as poultice to speed up frostbite healing. One dose will heal 1d10 wounds lost to the effects of Exposure to cold weather. Can be repeated daily.
item.name: Juck

item.description: Hills herb available during spring. When eaten raw, each dose gives +10 to the next Casting Test. With each dose roll 1d10, if the number is lower or equal the number of doses already eaten  that day, the dose has no effect.
item.name: Mage-Leaf

item.description: Grassland herb available during spring. Infusion takes effect after 2d10 + 10 and puts the target to sleep. During first 4 hours chances of being woken by noise ale halved. Draught works the same but effect comes after 1d10 minutes and target is harder to wake up for 2 hours.
item.name: Schlafenkraut

item.description: Marsh herb available during autumn. Anyone who drinks its infusion, must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or suffer a -10 Int and -10 WP for 2d10 + 4 hours. A poultice can be used to remove a Bleeding Condition for a wound.
item.name: Slowmind

item.description: Marsh herb available during summer. Speeds up healing.
item.name: Sigmafoil

item.description: Hills herb available during spring. When ingested raw, it provides +10 to all Tests related to Packerâ€™s Pox. As draguht, it reduces the duration of the Packerâ€™s Pox by 1d10 days.
item.name: Speckled Rustwort

item.description: Forest herb available during summer. Infusion causes -10 penalty to all spellcasting Tests and +10 to all Tests to resist magic for (10 - T Bonus) hours. Draught has the same effect but for 1 hour only. However, the affected person will appear completely mundane to Second Sight.
item.name: Spellwort

item.description: Herb found in coniferous forest during autumn. Applied raw to a wound, on a successful Heal Test, it removes a Bleeding Condition. As poultice, it has similar effect but removes 1 extra Bleeding Condition for every SL of the Heal Test.
item.name: Spiderleaf

item.description: Herb found in mixed forests during summer. Poultice applied to a wound, sends the person into 24h deep sleep. The Endurance Test made to recover Wounds that day is Very Easy (+60). Can also be applied to weapons. When struck, the target must make a  Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or suffer a Fatigued Condition.
item.name: Tarrabeth

item.description: Herb found in forests during autumn. Eaten raw, it gives +20 bonus to Consume Alcohol Tests for the next 24 hours.
item.name: Trinkwort

item.description: Herb found in mixed forests during spring. Valerian infusion restores 1 Wound. The dose may be repeated once per day. Has no effect on Critical Wounds.
item.name: Valerian

item.description: Herb found on hills during spring. When ingested raw, the person is treated as resting. If the person rests during that time, the benefits of rest are doubled. After the dose wears off, it gives 1 Fatigued Condition for 1 hour.
item.name: Vanera

item.description: Grassland herb available in summer. Vigwort infusion gives +10 I for 1d10 +4 minutes. After is wears off, the character must make an Average (+20) Endurance Test or gain a Fatigued Condition for each level of failure.
item.name: Vigwort

item.description: Clear oily liquid. Each dose boosts T and Ag by +10 but lowers Int and WP by -10. It also removes all Fatigued Conditions and no new can be gained until the effect wears off. The effect lasts T Bonus hours.
item.name: Estalian Mosca

item.description: The drinker receives 3 Stunned Conditions, and cannot make Endurance Tests to remove them until the effects of the potion wear of. During that time, they also gain the Immunity to Psychology and Painless Traits. The effect lasts 2+d10 hours.
item.name: Potion of Resistance

item.description:
Has a Strength of 50. Each attempt to escape it inflicts 1 Wound,
regardless of the T Bonus or Armour.
item.name: Barbed Net

item.description: Drinker gains Flight Creature Trait for 20 Rounds minus Toughness Bonus.
item.name: Potion of Flight

item.description: Skaven Moulder clan weapon. Barbed prod is used primarily for herding Rat Ogres, Ignores all Armour.
item.name: Beast-Prod

item.description: Large shield designed to shield small-crewed weapons from enemy fire. It makes all ranged attacks targeting the crew Hard (-20).
item.name: Pavise - Skaven version

item.description: Skaven Pestilens clan weapon. All living creatures around this weapon suffer exposure to Corruption. 8 yards - Minor, 4 yards - Moderate, 2 yards - Major.
item.name: Plague Censer

item.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon.
item.name: Punch Dagger

item.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon. Provides +10 to all Climb Tests.
item.name: Rat Claws

item.description: Weapon designed to be held or attached to your tail. Requires being a Skaven and having Tail Fighting Talent.
item.name: Tail Weapon

item.description: Skaven Moulder clan weapon.
item.name: Things-Catcher

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. When the globe shatters it releases a poisonous cloud 3 yd in diameter and 3 yd high that lasts for  1d10-1 rounds. All creatures within the cloud have to pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test every round or suffer a +4 Damage hit that ignores AP and T Bonus.
item.name: Poisoned Wind Globe

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. When the globe shatters it releases a poisonous cloud 4.5 yd in diameter and 3.75 yd high that lasts for  1d10-1 rounds. All creatures within the cloud have to pass a Hard (-20) Endurance Test every round or suffer a +1d10 Damage hit that ignores AP.
item.name: Death Globe

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan handheld rocket launcher. It is very unreliable, in case of fumble roll on table on p. 34.
item.name: Doomrocket Launcher

item.description: Skaven Moulder clan weapon.
item.name: Electro-Whip

item.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon. Can be set up to detonate for up to 10 rounds after it is dropped or thrown.
item.name: Infernal Bomb

item.description: Ammunition for Doomrocket Launcher.
item.name: Doomrocket

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan Poisoned Wind Globe launcher. Requires a team of 2 Skavens. The Enc value applies to main gunner. Has a min. range of 20.
item.name: Poisoned Wind Mortar

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan Poisoned Wind Globe launcher. Requires a team of 2 Skavens. The Enc value applies to main gunner.
item.name: Ratling Gun

item.description: Ammunition for Ratling Gun.
item.name: Ratling Gun Belt

item.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon. Creates smoke in area of 2 yd radius for 1d10 rounds. It prevent all ranged attacks, magic missiles, and attacks that relay on sight.
item.name: Smoke Bomb

item.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon.  It causes twice the normal number of Entangled Conditions.
item.name: Snare-Net

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. Requires a team of 2 Skavens. The Enc value applies to main gunner. Anyone hit by Warpfire Thrower must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain an Ablaze condition. Very unreliable, if the attack results in a Fumble, roll on the table on p. 36.
item.name: Warpfire Thrower

item.description: Ammunition for Warpfire Thrower.
item.name: Warpfire Fuel Vat

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. Requires a team of 2 Skavens. The Enc value is split between them. Mainly use to dig. It can cut a 5 ft diameter tunnel at a Movement rate of 2.
item.name: Warp-grinder

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. Usually requires a second Skaven to hold and stabilise the barrel. Can use regular blackpowder and shot but this reduces its Range to 72 and Damage to +5. In case of a Fumble, roll 1d10. On 1, the riffle explodes in a Blast 1 explosion dealing the same Damage as a successful shot. On 2-10 roll on the table in WFRP on page 160.
item.name: Warplock Jezzail - v2

item.description: Skaven large rifle.
item.name: Warplock Jezzail

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. In case of a Fumble, roll 1d10. On 1, the riffle explodes in a Blast 1 explosion dealing the same Damage as a successful shot. On 2-10 roll on the table in WFRP on page 160.
item.name: Warplock Pistol - v2

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. Can be loaded with either a regular Warpstone Bullet, or with Warpstone Buckshot. In case of a Fumble, roll 1d10. On 1, the riffle explodes in a Blast 1 explosion dealing the same Damage as a successful shot. On 2-10 roll on the table in WFRP on page 160.
item.name: Warpmusket - v2

item.description: Skaven pistol.
item.name: Warplock Pistol

item.description: Skaven musket.
item.name: Warpmusket

item.description: Skaven Eshin clan weapon.
item.name: Warpstone Star

item.description: Ammunition for Warplock Jezzail.
item.name: Jezzail Bullet and Powder

item.description: Ammunition for Warplock Pistol and Warpmusket.
item.name: Warpstone Bullet and Powder

item.description: Ammunition for Warpmusket.
item.name: Warpstone Buckshot

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan item. Provides +40 to all Endurance Tests made to resist the effects of inhaled poisons or gasses.
item.name: Gas Mask

item.description: Skaven Pestilens clan item. Contains a details recording of every corruption and plague since the clanâ€™s emergence.
item.name: Liber Bubonicus

item.description: Skaven ointment. Instantly cures 1d10 + 1 Wounds but each use counts as Moderate Exposure to Corruption.
item.name: Skalm

item.description: Skaven drink. For effect roll 1d100 on table on p. 40. The effect lasts for 2d10 - T Bonus (min. 1). No-Skaven must make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test when the effects ends. If they fail, they gain 1 Poisoned and 1 Bleeding Condition. In case of Astounding Failure, they also suffer 1 Ablaze Condition.
item.name: Skavenbrew

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Bless with Filth

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Bless with Filth - v2

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Cloud of Corruption

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Mantle of Contagion

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Pestilent Breath

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Poisonous Pustule

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Putrefy

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Toxic Rain

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Veil of Flies

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Weeping Wound

item.description: Pestilens clan item. Contains a spell that can be cast once without a Casting Test. There is no chance of a miscast or a critical.
item.name: Warp Scroll - Wither

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan item. When attached to a ranged weapon, it negates difficulty penalties for shooting at a target in cover.
item.name: Warlock Optics

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan item. When used with a Warp-blade, the blade gains +1 Damage.
item.name: Warp Energy Condenser

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. The blade is surrounded by tangle of wires that feed the blade with Warp energy.
item.name: Warp-Blade Halberd

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. The blade is surrounded by tangle of wires that feed the blade with Warp energy.
item.name: Warp-Blade Hand Weapon

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan item. When equipped, improves Warp Lightning Spell. The caster can reverse the dice used for the Casting Test. In case of miscast, the caster must pass a Hard (-30) Dexterity Test to disable the device or it explodes dealing 3d10 Damage to everyone within 3 yds and counts as  Moderate Exposure to Corruption to everyone within 5 yds.
item.name: Warp-Power Accumulator

item.description: Coins with addition of Warpstone. The Skaven use is at fuel and currency.
item.name: Warpstone Token

item.description: Skaven poison. Anyone damaged by a weapon covered with it, must make a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test or suffer 3 more Wounds that ignore AP and T Bonus.
item.name: Dark Kiss

item.description: Skaven poison. Anyone damaged by a weapon covered with it, must make a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or roll on the Stinking Drunk table (WFRP, p. 121). While under the influence, every time they are asked a question, they must pass a Difficult (-10) Willpower Test or they answer truthfully.
item.name: Foolmaker

item.description: Skaven Warpstone powder. When consumed, it grants (one time) +1 SL to Channelling Test. In case of a miscast, the caster has to add +10 to any roll on the miscast.
item.name: Warpstone Snuff

item.description: Allows any Skaven who wears it to reroll a single Test once every 13 hours.
item.name: Warpstone Charm

item.description: Trap made of semi-circular jaws that spring when a victim steps on it. The hit is determined by performing opposed Perception Test (vs Set Trap Test). Does SB+4 Dmg (Leg hits only) and has Fast and Penetrating Qualities. If the trap is chained, the victim is held in place until freed, otherwise it causes 1 Entangled Condition. Can opened on a successful Difficult (-10) Strength Test.
item.name: Man-trap

item.description: Full of shrapnel, creates massive and deadly explosion. Often used in tunnel fighting.
item.name: Cinderblast Bomb - v2

item.description: Non-magical weapons covered with Ghostsmear can hit creatures with Ethereal Trait. The effects lasts for 1 hour but stops immediately if the weapon is used to wound a living creature. Can only be made by  priests of Morr and requires 3 GC worth of ingredients. Can be stored for 1 year.
item.name: Ghostsmear

item.description: When consumed grants powerful visions of past and future. To determine the effects, Roll 1d100 on table on p. 31.
item.name: Purple Cap Mushrooms

item.description: Chainmail leg armour. Wearer can only whisper.
item.name: Quietened Chainmail Chausses

item.description: Chainmail body and arms armour. Wearer can only whisper.
item.name: Quietened Chainmail Coat

item.description: Chainmail head armour. It has -10 Perception penalty. Wearer can only whisper.
item.name: Quietened Chainmail Coif

item.description: Chainmail leg armour. Wearer can only whisper. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Quietened Chainmail Chausses - v2

item.description: Chainmail body and arms armour. Wearer can only whisper. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Quietened Chainmail Coat - v2

item.description: Chainmail head armour. It has -10 Perception penalty. Wearer can only whisper. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Quietened Chainmail Coif - v2

item.description: Ignores any AP provided by armour that has the Weakpoints Flaw.
item.name: Throatseeker's Blade

item.description: A five-volume exploration of the nature of Chaos written by Richter Kless.
item.name: Liber Chaotica

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 2 hours. Drinker suffers -2 SL to all Fel and Dex based Tests. They also gain Distracting Creature Trait. Lasts 1d10 hours.
item.name: Boar's Musk

item.description: Potion. Onset time: immediate. Drinker gains + 2 SL to all Channelling Tests. Lasts 1d10 minutes.
item.name: Channelpath Potion

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 minutes. Drinker passes all Consume Alcohol Tests. Lasts 1d10 hours.
item.name: Debauchâ€™s Friend

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 round. Reduce spell and ritual CNs by half. Lasts 2d10 rounds.
item.name: Draught of Power

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 15 minutes. Cases hair growth to applied body area. One dose is enough to cover whole human scalp. Lasts until hair naturally falls out.
item.name: Hair Tonic

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 hour. Gives the drinker +1 SL to all Int and WP based Tests and immunity to Fatigued Condition. Lasts 3d10 hours, after which the drinker receives 3 Fatigued Conditions.
item.name: Lucidity Tonic

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 hour. Drinker gains +1 SL to all Fel based Tests involving characters that are ordinarily attracted to the drinker's species and gender. Lasts 3d10 hours.
item.name: Nectar of Beauty

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 hour. Drinker has to pass a Hard (-20) Cool Test every time they want to lie. Lasts 3d10 hours.
item.name: Nectar of Veracity

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 round. Drinker gains Regenerate Creature Trait. Lasts 3d10 minutes.
item.name: Nectar of Vitality

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 rounds. Drinker recovers 3 times T Bonus Wounds. It removes any Bleeding or Fatigued Conditions. Removes any diseases on a successful Average (+20) Endurance Test. Can remove Critical Injury (see table on p. 163).
item.name: Panacea Universalis

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 rounds. Drinker gains +2 to S and T Bonus. They also gain +2 SL to any S or T based Test. Lasts 1d10 hours.
item.name: Potency Draught

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 rounds. Drinker gains Flight (20) Creature Trait. Lasts 1d10 minutes.
item.name: Potion of Flight - v2

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1 round. Drinker can make an Easy (+40) Augury using their Int if they do not have the Augury Skill.
item.name: Potion of Fortune

item.description: Potion. Onset time: 1d10 rounds. Drinker becomes invisible. Creatures with Second Sight Talent may detect the drinker but suffer a -2 SL penalty on their Perception Test. Lasts 1d10 minutes.
item.name: Potion of Invisibility

item.description: Special wine that can be used with Augury Skill. After drinking you must pass a Challenging (+0) Consume Alcohol Test. If you fail the Test the following apply. Gain Sixth Sense and Magical Sense Talents and receive a +2 SL bonus to any Intuition based Tests. You can chose to gain an extra Fortune point or make a roll on the Augury Table using your Intelligence rather than the Augury Skill. Consuming the wine, causes Minor Corruption Exposure. You must also pass an Average (+20) Cool Test or will "hear the call". If you hear the call more times than you WP Bonus you abandon your life and travel to the Grey Mountain vineyards.
item.name: Dreamwine

item.description: Gromil Open Helm.
item.name: Gromril Helm

item.description: Gromil Open Helm. It is marked as v2 because this is a new version of an armour from the Rulebook that has different properties and uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III.
item.name: Gromril Helm  - v2

item.description: A Dagger that is Magical.
item.name: Magical Dagger

item.description: An Arabyan spyglass. Can see through any obfuscation, including magical.
item.name: Enchanted Spyglass

item.description: Prevent the wearer from suffering any natural temperature extremes (both hot and cold).
item.name: Jarl Fur Jacket

item.description: Device that can track Morrslieb's movements.
item.name: Roth's Moondial

item.description: The wearer gains Flight (45) and Magic Resistance (2) Creature Traits.
item.name: Cloak of Feathers

item.description: Every time a creature is wounded by a it, they must take a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test or suffer a Poisoned Condition.
item.name: Plaguesword

item.description:
Made out of Weirdroot. Gives +10 bonus to WP Tests and -10 to
Ag, I, and Int Tests. Effect lasts 1d10 x 10 minutes.
item.name: Ameliorative Elixir

item.description: Gives +20 to Int and Endurance Tests. Effect lasts 1d10 hours. After than gain 1 Fatigued Condition that lasts for at least a day.
item.name: Focusing Philtre

item.description: Drinker gains receives the benefit of the Attractive Talent for 1d10 hours. After it wears off, they suffer -20 to all Fel tests for 1d10 days.
item.name: Katya's Cordial

item.description: Gain +1 Fortune point for 1d10 minutes. If you spend that point roll d100, if you roll a double, regain it. When the effect wears off, you lose all your Fortune points and gain 1 Fatigued Condition that lasts for at least a day.
item.name: Liquor of Luck

item.description: To drink it, you must first pass an Average (+20) Cool Test. If successful, gain 1 Fatigued Condition which can only be removed after a good night's rest. There are no other effects.
item.name: The Marvellous Medicinal Mixture

item.description: While under its effect, you cannot gain Surprised Condition. Lasts 1d10 hours. After it wears off, gain 1 Fatigued Condition that lasts at least a day.
item.name: Reactionary Restorative

item.description: Roll 1d10. Depending on result gain 1 of the following Talents for: 1d10 minutes: 1-2: Acute Sense - Sight, 3-4: Holy Visions, 5-6: Magical Sense, 7-8: Second Sight, 9-10: all of the above.
item.name: Tonic of Sight Beyond Sight

item.description: Antidote. Forms: potion. Does nothing on its own. When combined with a poison, it becomes antidote to that exact poison.
item.name: Bezoar Solvent

item.description: Concoction. Forms: raw, potion. Grants Painless Creature Trait for 1 hour.
item.name: Bloodblind

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Grants Breath +10 (Fire) Creature Trait for 1 time use. Immediately after breathing fire, the user must pass a a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or gain 1 Ablaze Condition.
item.name: Carroburg Fire

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Grants Cold-blooded Creature Trait. The drinker can reverse any failed Willpower based Tests. If they gain Surprised Condition, it is not lost  the first time it should be.
item.name: Clearmind

item.description: Poison. Forms: potion, unguent, raw. If a weapon covered with it inflicts at least 1 Wound, it inflicts additional 1d10 Wounds. If consumed in any form, one has to pass a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or suffer an immediate Critical Hit to the torso.
item.name: Flesh Blister

item.description: Concoction. Forms: unguent. Grants 4 AP against all fire damage and immunity to the Ablaze Condition. The user also suffer -20 to Ag and I. Effect lasts 1 hour.
item.name: Forge Shield

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Can be used on a corpse not older than 1 day. The corpse can be asked 3 questions. If it is asked a fourth question, it will rise as a Thing from the Dead Wood.
item.name: Last Gasp

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. When poured out, it immediately starts to burn on any surface. If used as weapon, it can be treated as Incendiary bomb. Any Ablaze Condition gained from it cannot be put out for 3 rounds.
item.name: Liquid Fire

item.description: Poison. Forms: potion. Very difficult to detect, any attempt suffers a -40 penalty. When ingested, the target must pass s a Hard (-20) Endurance Test. If they fail, they feel tired a little earlier than usual. After they go to sleep, they must attempt another Hard (-20) Endurance Test. If they fail that one as well, they die in their sleep from seemingly natural causes.
item.name: Longsleep

item.description: Antidote. Forms: potion. Within 1 minute after drinking, the target becomes sober. The drinker becomes Fatigued for number of hours equal to 10 minus their Toughness Bonus.
item.name: Laurek's Cure

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion, unguent, raw. Grants Frenzy for 1d10 Rounds.
item.name: Preyton's Fury

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion, unguent. Creates a magical fire. When used as incendiary bomb, attacks count as Magical. Unguent can be smeared on the weapon and set alight for 1d10 Rounds. During that time the weapon inflicts a single Ablaze Condition with each strike and counts as Magical.
item.name: Razorburn

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion, unguent. Imbiber must pass a  Consume Alcohol Test. If the succeed they can spend a Fortune Point within the next hour to reverse the dice of any failed Test.
item.name: Seer Snake Liquor

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. The drinker must take a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test. If they fail, they gain 2 Poisoned Conditions. If they pass, they gain Corrosive Blood Creature Trait for 3 + SL Rounds.
item.name: Spite

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Drinker becomes immune to all poisons for 1 hour.
item.name: Stag's Ward

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. The imbiber gains 3 Poisoned Conditions (cannot be resisted), recovers T Bonus of Wounds, and gains Regenerate Creature Trait. Regenerate Creature Trait lasts for as long as the last Poisoned Condition.
item.name: Tide Blood

item.description: Concoction. Forms: unguent. When applied, covered body parts change colour to match the environment. Gives +40 to Stealth Tests relying on sight.
item.name: Treemeld

item.description:
Concoction. Forms: potion, raw. Extremally corrosive. If used as a weapon, causes +9 Damage and has Penetrating Quality and
Dangerous Flaw.
item.name: Troll Acid

item.description:
Antidote. Forms: potion, unguent. Grants +40 bonus to resist
the effects of any poison.
item.name: Two-Headed Tincture

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion, unguent. Used to treat wounds. When applied as unguent, it removes all Bleeding Conditions without a Heal Test. In potion form, it removes 1 Bleeding Condition at the end of each Round for 1 hour. In addition, vampires do not heal Wounds if they drink imbiber's blood.
item.name: Veinpowder

item.description: Poison. Forms: potion. Causes unusual fatigue for 6 hours. Any moderate physical task inflicts a Fatigued Condition. Anything that would normally result in Fatigued Condition, inflicts 2 Conditions instead. At the end of each hour, the victim may attempt a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test to shake off this effect. If they pass they no longer gain Fatigued Conditions due to Wheeze.
item.name: Wheeze

item.description: Concoction. Forms: potion. Grants Magic Resistance 3 Creature Trait for 1 hour. If used multiple times, each dose increases resistance by 1 and duration by 1 hour. For each dose consumed after the first, the imbiber must make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test. If they fail, they  receive 1 Poisoned Condition each Round for 10 Rounds. All Poisoned Conditions are removed after 10 Rounds.
item.name: Witchbane

item.description: Poison. Forms: unguent. Whenever a weapon covered with it causes at least 1 Wound, the victim must pass Endurance Test or take an additional 5 Wounds that ignore Toughness and AP. It evaporates from weapons within 2+1d10 Rounds.
item.name: Wyvern's Kiss

item.description: Skaven Skryre clan weapon. Ignores Metal Armour. If it causes at least 1 Wound, the victim has to pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test or gain a Stunned Condition.
item.name: Warp Blade

item.description: A Dagger that is Magical.
item.name: Magical Dagger - copy

item.description: Dwarf dagger made out of Great Eagle Talon.
item.name: Eagle Shank

item.description: Every time this dagger inflicts at least 1 Wound, the target immediately take a Poisoned Condition resisted with a Difficult (-10) Endurance Test. When the poison runs dry, Fell Dagger shatters.
item.name: Fell Dagger

item.description: Sword with hilt made of Great Stag Antler. Even though it can corrode, crack or bend, it will never break in battle.
item.name: Antler Hilted Blade

item.description: Sword with hilt made of Great Stag Antler. Even though it can corrode, crack or bend, it will never break in battle. Inflicts Bleeding Condition on both its wielder and its victim every time it is used to inflict a Critical Wound.
item.name: Antler Hilted Blade - Bleeding

item.description: Plate body armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. Uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III. Lighter than usual because it is made out of Leviathan Scale or Carapace.
item.name: Leviathan Breastplate

item.description: Plate legs armour. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. Uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III. Lighter than usual because it is made out of Leviathan Scale or Carapace.
item.name: Leviathan Plate Leggings

item.description: Open plate head armour. It imposes -10 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty. Uses new rules from Archives of the Empire Vol III. Lighter than usual because it is made out of Leviathan Scale or Carapace.
item.name: Leviathan Helm

item.description: Made with Griffon Feathers by the master-fletchers of Ostermark.
item.name: Griffon Fletching Arrow

item.description: Made with Griffon Feathers by the master-fletchers of Ostermark.
item.name: Griffon Fletching Bolt

item.description: Can be used to cover up to 6 bolts of arrows to give them Penetrating Quality. Once covered, they have to be used within 1 day. After 1 day they become useless.
item.name: Tregara Sap

item.description:
Any attack that inflict at least 1 Wound, also inflicts one
Bleeding Condition.
item.name: Shard Tips Bolt

item.description:
Any attack that inflict at least 1 Wound, also inflicts one
Bleeding Condition.
item.name: Shard Tips Arrow

item.description: Is flat and heavy on one side for pummelling damage and has a spike on another for penetrating damage. After killing an opponent, every living creature within 10 yards, other than the wielder of the hammer, must make a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or gain a Deafened Condition and suffer 1d10 Wounds which bypass AP.
item.name: Bone Smasher

item.description: A regular sword. Well balanced. Contains Siren hair in the hilt. The wielder cannot speak, scream etc.
item.name: Silence Sword

item.description: Deadlier version of a knife. Contains Siren hair in the hilt. The wielder cannot speak, scream etc.
item.name: Silence Dagger

item.description: Bearer can see Undead creature as they looked in life. This removes the Fear Trait of any Undead, unless whatever creature they were in life would naturally have this Trait.
item.name: Wightseer

item.description: For the purposes of Opposed Strength Tests, the wearer counts their size as one step larger than it actually is.
item.name: Throttler's Gloves

item.description: This Cloak grant Fear 2 in Wolves, Lions, Goats, and Chimeras.
item.name: Wulfshawl

item.description: A cup made out of a skull of Undead. By drinking from the cup, the imbiber can see and talk to ghosts an spirits. The effects lasts 1 minute but may be extended by taking more sips.
item.name: The Last Toast

item.description: Magical ruby can absorb any blood. When it does, it grants Ward 9+ Creature Trait for 1d10 Rounds. If the wearer gains a Bleeding Condition they must pass a Challenging (+0) Endurance Test or the stone will attach itself to the wound. While it is attached, the Bleeding Condition cannot be removed. The stone can be removed by with a successful Average (+20) Strength Test.
item.name: The Thristy Stone

item.description: Magic workshop with variety of ingredients and tools required for magic research.
item.name: Workshop - Magic

item.description: Library filled with books about magic.
item.name: Library - Magic

item.description: Flask with enchanted miasma. When opened, it releases cloud of gas. Everyone in the room suffer Blinded Condition. If they fail an Average (+20) Endurance Test, they also suffer from the Convulsions symptom for d10 turns.
item.name: Enchanted Miasma

item.description: Vial of Schlaff poison. Anyone affected by it shows the following symptoms: slurred speech, apathy, sleepiness, and heave red-rimmed eyes. A Character with medical knowledge may attempt a Hard (-20) Lore - Medicine Test to identify the cause of these symptoms. If a character consumes it, they need to pass a Hard (-20) Endurance Test or gain one Fatigued Condition for each dose consumed.
item.name: Vial of Schlaf

item.description:
A mix of Black Lotus, Warpstone, and other unpleasant materials. When consumed, it puts the person in a blissful trance that can last for days. The person must pass a Very Hard (-30) Toughness Test, gaining the Unconscious Condition for a number of hours equal to twice -SL, to a minimum of 4.
Each dose is a Minor Corruption, but if the slumber lasts more than 8 hours it's a Moderate Corruption. After walking up, the person must pass a Hard (-20) Toughness Test or gain a Fatigued Condition that lasts 3 days or until another dose is taken.
item.name: Skitter

item.description: Military flail with a hollow head filled with burning coals. Anyone hit by it gets SL Ablaze Conditions.
item.name: Censer-Flail

item.description: Enchanted bullets and powder. The bullets ignore all magical armour. The victim suffers -8 SL to casting spells as long as the bullet is in their body. To remove the bullet, someone with Surgery Talent must pass Extended Challenging (+0) Heal Test that requires 8 SL. Each Test requires half an hour.
item.name: Enchanted Bullet and Powder

item.description: Bangle or pendant made out of bones, teeth or similar. Used by Orc and Goblin shamans. Allows shaman to reroll 1 Casting Test.
item.name: Dangly Wotnotz

item.description: Shaman who has it may reroll any Melee Tests made to attack an opponent.
item.name: Effigy of Gork

item.description: Shaman who has it may reroll any Dodge Tests or Melee Tests made to oppose an attack.
item.name: Effigy of Mork

item.description: Gives the Shaman Magic Resistance 2 Talent. Every time the bearer is targeted by a spell they must roll 1d100. On 01 they suffer 1d10 Wounds that ignore TB and Armour and gain Prone Condition.
item.name: Glowy Green Amulet

item.description: While holding the staff, the Shaman is isolated from other Orcs and Goblins. They suffer -2SL to Channelling and Casting Tests. They ignore presence of Orcs, Hobgoblins, and Goblins when rolling on the Waaagh! Miscast Table.
item.name: Copper Staf

item.description: Roll 1d10 for any given staff. The Shaman always counts as being within Willpower Bonus yards of that many Orcs when Channelling, Casting, or rolling on the Waaagh! Miscast Table.
item.name: Shaman Staff

item.description: The mushroom sprout from the bodies of infested Night Goblin Shamans. When eaten, for the next 2d10 Rounds, the Shaman counts as being within Willpower Bonus yards of 2d10 Orcs when Channelling, Casting, or rolling on the Waaagh! Miscast Table.
item.name: Shaman Shrooms

item.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour.
item.name: Gromril Breastplate

item.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour. Wearer suffers -10% to Perception.
item.name: Gromril Open Helm

item.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour.
item.name: Gromril Bracers

item.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour. Wearer suffers -10 to Stealth.
item.name: Gromril Leggings

item.description: Highest quality Dwarf Plate Armour. Wearer suffers -20% to Perception.
item.name: Gromril Gromril Helm - v3

item.description: Dwarf chainmail leg armour. Wearing any Mail imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty.
item.name: Mail Skirt

item.description:
Open plate head armour topped with candle sockets. It imposes -10 to Perception. Wearing any Plate imposes a -10 Stealth Penalty.
Advanced versions have been adapted to accommodate a directional Storm Lantern.
item.name: Miner's Open Helm

item.description: Improved version of a regular axe. Well balanced and good against armour.
item.name: Dwarf Axe

item.description: Improved version of a regular warhammer. Well balanced and capable of pummeling damage.
item.name: Dwarf Warhammer

item.description: Axes attached to chains used by Doomseekers of Grimnir.
item.name: Whirling blades of death

item.description: Dwarf version of a two-handed battle axe.
item.name: Dwarf Greataxe

item.description: Dwarven, large two-handed battle hammer.
item.name: Dwarf Greathammer

item.description: Large dwarven pick. Often sold with a handful of candles, which can be lashed to the weapon as an improvised light source in desperate circumstances.
item.name: Dwarf Pick

item.description: Highly advanced dwarven drilling equipment.
item.name: Steam Drill

item.description: Highly advanced, unique dwarven axe that can be use to trap opponents weapon.
item.name: Cog Axe

item.description: Highly advanced dwarven contraption. Can be used to do both massive damage and defend against incoming attacks.
item.name: Steam Gauntlet

item.description: Dwarven made, medium range, two-handed firearm made out of metal barrel mounted on a wooden stock. More reliable than regular handgun, misfires only on a roll of 100.
item.name: Dwarf Handgun - v2

item.description: Dwarven made, compact version of a handgun that can be used with one hand and reloaded more easily. More reliable than regular pistol, misfires only on a roll of 100.
item.name: Dwarf Pistol - v2

item.description: Built by best dwarven craftsman, more deadly than  most regular crossbow.
item.name: Dwarf Crossbow - v2

item.description: Dwarven drakefire gun,  inflicts the Ablaze Condition on affected targets

item.description: Large source of light. Provides light within 40 yards when lit.

item.description: Includes pots, buckets, kettles, bottles, etc.

item.description: Used  for inscribing records that withstand the passage of time.

item.description: Brewer workshops usually have mills, tanks, kegs, and bottling lines.

item.description: Workshop with tools required for most ambitious masonry projects.
item.name: Workshop - Mason

item.description: Platform used by some of the Dwarf lords to get a height advantage in battle. Requires 2 bearers to carry the platform.
item.name: Shield Platform

item.description: Piece of a Dwarf â€™s mountain home carried into battle with them. It is a carved rock inscribed with runes. In combat, character can use Move action to place and stand upon an Oathstone. When standing on it, they: gain +20 to any Tests to resist forced movement, including Tests to resist gaining the Broken Condition; enemies do not gain bonus attack modifiers for outnumbering you in melee, or for attacking you in the side or rear; suffer -20 penalty on all Dodge Skill Tests.
item.name: Oathstone

item.description: Legendary anvil required to craft the most powerful runes. It is also required to strike Doom Runes. Provides +20 all Runesmithing Extended Tests. Any Dwarf within 2 yards of an Anvil of Doom gains +20 on Tests to dispel magic with Magic Resistance.
item.name: Anvil of Doom

item.description: Magical amulet that grants Ward 1 worn by priests of Taal.
item.name: Amber Periapt

item.description: Herb used to distract tracking dogs. Dogs within 5 yards of the herb have to pass an Average (+20) Willpower Test. If they fail, they investigate the bag for 1d10 rounds before resuming tracking. On Astounding Failure (-6 SL or worse) they completely lose the trail.
item.name: Bag of Tarrabeth Seed

item.description: Darkens equipment and skin to improve stealth in darkness. Anyone trying to spot/identify user receives -1 SL to sight-based Perception Tests.
item.name: Bag of Soot

item.description: Creates 2-yard hazardous area that damages and slows movement. Requires multiple caltrops and 1 Action to deploy. Entering the area requires Hard (-20) Athletics Test. If the character is walking with awareness the Test becomes Average (+20). On Fail: Random leg takes 1d10 damage + Surprised condition.
item.name: Caltrops (set of 12)

item.description: Boot attachments that affect climbing and movement. Two are required to be effective. +2 SL climbing rock/wood, +1 SL climbing rope. All non-climbing actions: -1 SL Athletics/Agility, -2 SL Stealth, -2 SL other movement Tests.
item.name: Crampon (set of 2)

item.description: Tool for cutting glass panels. Requires Average (+20) Art (Engraving) Test to create an opening. If the result of the Test is less than 1 SL, see table on page 33 in Deft Steps Light Fingers.
item.name: Glass Cutter

item.description: A device with angled mirrors that allows sight around corners or over obstacles. Enables sight-based Perception Tests while remaining in cover.
item.name: Periscope

item.description: This throwable device provides concealment by creating a thick cloud of smoke, useful for escaping or obscuring vision. When thrown, creates a 10-yard diameter smoke cloud lasting 2d10 Rounds (doubled in enclosed spaces). Vision limited to 1 yard inside the cloud. Characters in the cloud must test for Suffocation.
item.name: Smoke Bomb

item.description: This specialised breaking tool lets you bypass locks or bolts without picking the lock mechanism. Requires Hard (-20) Sleight of Hand Test to use. If the result of the Test is less than 1 SL, see table on page 33 in Deft Steps Light Fingers.
item.name: Steel Mummit

item.description: Extendable pole reaching up to 12 feet (4 yards). Allows Dexterity Tests to manipulate distant objects with -2 SL penalty.
item.name: Telescopic Stick

item.description: Clothing that lets you blend in better. +2 SL to any Stealth Tests that are made in the appropriate terrain.
item.name: Hunterâ€™s Garb

trait.description:
For 2 Advantage activate Breath Free Attack. Target 1 opponent within 20+TB yards. All characters within SB yards and all characters between the on the path to the target are struck. Perform an Opposed Ballistic Skill/Dodge Test against all affected targets. Whoever fails, takes 1 Damage. 
Cold effect: Targets gain a Stunned Condition for every full 5 Wounds suffered (minimum of 1).
trait.name: Breath Cold 1

trait.description:
For 2 Advantage activate Breath Free Attack. Target 1 opponent within 20+TB yards. All characters within SB yards and all characters between the on the path to the target are struck. Perform an Opposed Ballistic Skill/Dodge Test against all affected targets. Whoever fails, takes 1 Damage. 
Corrosion effect: Armour and Weapons carried by affected targets suffer 1 Damage.
trait.name: Breath Corrosion 1

trait.description:
For 2 Advantage activate Breath Free Attack. Target 1 opponent within 20+TB yards. All characters within SB yards and all characters between the on the path to the target are struck. Perform an Opposed Ballistic Skill/Dodge Test against all affected targets. Whoever fails, takes 1 Damage. 
Fire effect: This attack ignores APs. Affected targets gain Ablaze Condition.
trait.name: Breath Fire 1

trait.description:
For 2 Advantage activate Breath Free Attack. Target 1 opponent within 20+TB yards. All characters within SB yards and all characters between the on the path to the target are struck. Perform an Opposed Ballistic Skill/Dodge Test against all affected targets. Whoever fails, takes 1 Damage. 
Electricity effect: This attack ignores APs. Affected targets gain Stunned Condition.
trait.name: Breath Electricity 1

trait.description:
For 2 Advantage activate Breath Free Attack. Target 1 opponent within 20+TB yards. All characters within SB yards and all characters between the on the path to the target are struck. Perform an Opposed Ballistic Skill/Dodge Test against all affected targets. Whoever fails, takes 1 Damage. 
Poison effect: This attack ignores APs. Affected targets gain Poisoned Condition.
trait.name: Breath Poison 1

trait.description:
For 2 Advantage activate Breath Free Attack. Target 1 opponent within 20+TB yards. All characters within SB yards and all characters between the on the path to the target are struck. Perform an Opposed Ballistic Skill/Dodge Test against all affected targets. Whoever fails, takes 1 Damage. 
Smoke effect: The area fills with smoke, blocking Line of Sight
for TB Rounds.

trait.name: Brute

Skill/Melee or Dodge Test. If is wins, the target loses 1d10 + SL Wounds without AP or TB modification. The attack counts as Magical.

Animal has been trained using Animal Training Skill.

War - Gains +10 WS and ignores Skittish when it comes to loud noises.

The creature performs an Opposed Ballistic Skill/Dodge Test against each target. The Test is Easy (+40) for the creature and Challenging (+0) for the targets. Losing opponents are hit with TB +4 Damage, receive Stunned Condition, and all Armour and Weapon suffer 1 Damage due to Corrosion.

trait.description: On every successful hit, the opponent receives 1 Entangled Condition with strength 1.

trait.description: Creature can move by tunneling underground up to 30 yards.  See detailed rules in Imperial Zoo p. 23

trait.description:
At the end of the Round, if the creature has a higher Advantage than all engaged opponents, it absorbs one opponent of equal Size or smaller. The victim receives number of Entangled Conditions equal to creatures SB and is in a Grapple. Each Round (at the end), the absorbed victim loses Wounds equal to creatures TB and the creature heals TB Wounds. Any attack that hits the creature do the same Damage to the absorbed victim.
If the absorbed victim is killed, the creature retreats to digest the corpse for the next few days.
trait.name: Absorb

trait.description: Creature is a shapeless blob. Reduce by half all Damage not caused by fire, cold, or magic. It cannot be Critically Wounded. If reduced to 0 Wounds, it becomes dormant for 1d10 Rounds, then regenerates +1 Wound.

trait.description: If the creature touches the victim, they have to pass a Contraction Test that is 2 steps more Difficult than normal. If the disease is contracted, its Incubation is changed to Instant.
trait.name: Blighted - The Black Plague

trait.description: Requires Daemonic Trait as well. The creature can prepare and wear flesh of any Human it kills. This allows it to perfectly impersonate the victim. Detailed rules in Enemy in Shadows p. 148.

trait.description: The creature is completely mindless. It does not have Initiative, Intelligence, Willpower, or Fellowship. For Wounds calculations use S Bonus instead of WP Bonus. It always takes it Turn last in and Round.

trait.description: When the creature loses all its Wounds or  suffers a Critical Wound, it is replaced by two Blue Horrors.

trait.description: All creatures of the same type in the vicinity pool their power. One Horror becomes a caster and can cast 1 Tzeentch Spell during their Round. Pink Horrors cast the Pink Fire of Tzeentch; other creatures cast the Blue Fire of Tzeentch. Each additional creature adds +1 SL up to +9 SL.

trait.description: Creatures bite does not cause pain, it can attach undetected. The effect wears off 10 - T Bonus Rounds after the creature detaches.

trait.description: When making Fellowship Test to deal with this creature, roll 1d10. 1: -2SL, 2-3: -1SL, 4-7: no effect, 8-9: +1 SL, 10: +2 SL.

trait.description: Cannot run.

trait.description: Anyone within 2 yards must pass an Average (+20) Willpower Test or they receive 1 Stunned Condition for each level of failure.

trait.description: Cyclopean eye of Fimir gives them Second Sight Talent. All Second Sight Tests for Skill Tests gain +2 SL. Language (Magick) and Channelling Test gain +1 SL. When the creature suffers a Miscast, they make a Difficult (-10) Perception Test. If they succeed, the spell still fails but they do not suffer miscast effects.

trait.description:
For 2 Advantage activate Breath Free Attack. Target 1 opponent within 20+TB yards. All characters within SB yards and all characters between the on the path to the target are struck. Perform an Opposed Ballistic Skill/Dodge Test against all affected targets. Whoever fails, takes 1 Damage. 
Warpfire effect: details in Empire in Ruins Companion p. 21.

trait.description: Creature can change colour to blend with environment better. All Perception Tests to spot it suffer -4 SL it it is still and -2 SL if it is moving. Ranged Tests to shoot at the creature also suffer -2 SL.

Marked by the Chotec, chosen for a great destiny. Unique to Lizardmen.
Gain +10 I and Ag.

Gain Hatred - Skaven and Immunity - Poison Trait.

Gain +15 Fel.
Gain Luck Talent.
Gain Leader Trait.
trait.name: Marks of the Old Ones

trait.description: The Daemon can make a Challenging (+0) WP Test. On success it summons 1d10 lesser daemons appropriate to its god. If the Daemon takes any wound, it must pass an Average (+20) Cool Test to be able to summon again. It can attempt the Test every Round. On Impressive Failure, it loses this ability completely.
trait.name: Living Gate

trait.description: Can move at full speed in water. When out of the water, their Movement drops to 1, and receive -2 SL to all Tests. They also need to be doused with water or they will begin to suffocate.
trait.name: Marine Creature

trait.description: Creature gains Frenzy and Etiquette - Followers of Khorne Talents. It suffers from Animosity towards followers of Slaanesh (and other way around if they can see the Mark). It can never use Language - Magick or Channeling skills unless to dispel a spell.
trait.name: Mark of Khorne

trait.description: Animal Familiar Trait. When the Familiar is within 4 yards, the spirit-bonded spellcaster has access to the following Talents (or get +1 SL if they already have it): Blather, Schemer
trait.name: Deception - Fox

trait.description: Animal Familiar Trait. When the Familiar is within 4 yards, the spirit-bonded spellcaster has access to the following Talents (or get +1 SL if they already have it): Holy Visions, Sixth Sense
trait.name: Divination - Owl

trait.description: Animal Familiar Trait. When the Familiar is within 4 yards, the spirit-bonded spellcaster has access to the following Talents (or get +1 SL if they already have it): Hunterâ€™s Eye, Shadowing
trait.name: Perception - Stoat

trait.description: Animal Familiar Trait. When the Familiar is within 4 yards, the spirit-bonded spellcaster has access to the following Talents (or get +1 SL if they already have it): Robust, Tenacious
trait.name: Resilience - Badger

trait.description: Animal Familiar Trait. When the Familiar is within 4 yards, the spirit-bonded spellcaster has access to the following Talents (or get +1 SL if they already have it):  Alley Cat, Rover
trait.name: Stealth - Cat

trait.description: Animal Familiar Trait. When the Familiar is within 4 yards, the spirit-bonded spellcaster has access to the following Talents (or get +1 SL if they already have it):  Nose for Trouble, Master of Disguise
trait.name: Transformation - Crow

trait.description: Whenever creature's immediate circumstances undergo a change they must pass an Easy (+40) Intelligence Test or receive 1 Stunned Condition. Each Round, they can attempt a new Easy (+40) Intelligence Test to remove this Condition.
trait.name: Easily Confused

trait.description: Creature receives -20 to all Tests to avoid Ablaze Condition. Suffers double Wounds from Ablaze Condition.
trait.name: Flammable

trait.description: Creature has Immunity to Psychology. It cannot take actions beside those which are associated with its attacks and Traits. Its reach depends on the size: Tiny or Little: Very Short, Small: Short, Average: Medium, Large: Long, Enormous: Very Long, Monstrous: Massive.
trait.name: Stationary Attacker

trait.description: If the creature does not have enough Advantage to use its Breath Trait, roll a d10. On a roll of 8 or more it may do so anyway.
trait.name: Font of Flame

trait.description: Unique to the Changeling Of Tzeentch. Once per Round, it can change to any typical creature or specific one if it studied it for a number of hours equal to the creatureâ€™s Intelligence Bonus. It gains access to all creature's Traits. When impersonating a specific creature it does not gain access to its memories.
trait.name: Formless Horror

trait.description: The creature gain 1d10/3 Mutations (rounded up, alternating between Physical and Mental) from table on p. 66 in Enemy in Shadows Companion. It gains Etiquette - Followers of Tzeentch Talent and Animosity towards followers of Nurgle (an other way around if the Mark is visible).
trait.name: Mark of Tzeentch

trait.description: Creature has a gift that allows it to see flaws in everything: organizations, objects, people. If it studies an opponent in combat for its Action, on the following Action, its attack ignores both Toughness Bonus and Armour Points.
trait.name: Piercing Gaze

trait.description: When attacked, the creature can cast spells from a random Lore. The Lore changes every Round. To determine the Lore, see table on p. 214 in Winds of magic or p. 18 in Empire in Ruins Companion.
trait.name: Random Caster

trait.description: This creature can shift at will between its regular form and a Great Cat. See detailed rules in Enemy in Shadows Companion p. 87.
trait.name: Shapeshifter - Great Cat

trait.description: Whenever a spell is cast, the creature can make an Opposed Willpower Test with the caster. If it succeeds, roll 1d10. 1-2: no effect, 3-7: the creature casts spell instead of the caster, 8-9: both creature and caster cast the spell, 10: both caster and the creature are in the centre of a Blast 5, Damage 6 explosion.
trait.name: Spell Syphon

trait.description: If the vampire wins an Opposed Willpower/Cool Test, the target comes under the Vampireâ€™s control. The effects lasts for 1+SL hours. Controlled targets may attempt an Average (+20) Cool Test if forced to do something they would normally find morally or physically repugnant.
trait.name: Vampiric Gaze
